[The deanery]3040-the deanery , formerly so quiet and sedate [a dwelling of [the one old man]1903-the one old man]1902-a dwelling of the one old man , was now to be filled with noise and merriment . Iron railings were being placed before three windows , evidently to be [the nursery]455-the nursery . In the summer publicity of open windows and doors , the sound of [the busy carpenters]1905-the busy carpenters was perpetually heard all over the Close : and by - and - by waggon - loads of furniture and carriage - loads of [people]446-people began to arrive . Neither [Miss Monro]77-miss monro nor [Ellinor]73-ellinor felt [themselves]1907-they of sufficient importance or station to call on [the new comers]1908-the new comers , but [they]1907-they were as well acquainted with the proceedings of [the family]2680-the family as if [they]1907-they had been in daily intercourse ; [they]1907-they knew that [the eldest Miss Beauchamp]159-the eldest miss beauchamp was seventeen , and very pretty , only one shoulder was higher than the other ; that [she]159-the eldest miss beauchamp was dotingly fond of dancing , and talked a great deal in a _ tete- a - tete _ , but not much if [[her]159-the eldest miss beauchamp mamma]1910-her mamma was by , and never opened [her]159-the eldest miss beauchamp lips at all if [the dean]1855-the dean was in [the room]479-the room ; that [the next sister]1913-the next sister was wonderfully clever , and was supposed to know all [the governess]1914-the governess could teach [her]1913-the next sister , and to have private lessons in Greek and mathematics from [[her]1913-the next sister father]398-her father ; and so on down to [the little boy at [the preparatory school]1917-the preparatory school]1916-the little boy at the preparatory school and [the baby - girl in arms]1918-the baby - girl in arms . Moreover , [Miss Monro]77-miss monro , at any rate , could have stood an examination as to the number of [servants at [the deanery]3040-the deanery]1919-servants at the deanery , [their]1919-servants at the deanery division of work , and the hours of [their]1919-servants at the deanery meals . Presently , [a very beautiful , haughty - looking young lady]1921-a very beautiful , haughty - looking young lady made [her]1921-a very beautiful , haughty - looking young lady appearance in [the Close]1771-the close , and in [[the dean]1855-the dean 's pew]1924-the dean 's pew . [She]1921-a very beautiful , haughty - looking young lady was said to be [[his]1855-the dean niece]1925-his niece , [the orphan daughter of [[his]1855-the dean brother]1496-his brother]1926-the orphan daughter of his brother , [General Beauchamp]160-general beauchamp , come to [East Chester]33-east chester to reside for the necessary time before [her]1921-a very beautiful , haughty - looking young lady marriage , which was to be performed in [the cathedral]3039-the cathedral by [[her]1921-a very beautiful , haughty - looking young lady uncle]395-her uncle , [the new dignitary]1930-the new dignitary . But as [callers at the deanery]1931-callers at the deanery did not see [this beautiful bride]1932-this beautiful bride elect , and as [the Beauchamps]161-the beauchamps had not as yet fallen into habits of intimacy with [any of [[their]161-the beauchamps new acquaintances]1934-their new acquaintances]1933-any of their new acquaintances , very little was known of the circumstances of this approaching wedding beyond the particulars given above . [Ellinor]73-ellinor and [Miss Monro]77-miss monro sat at [[their]161-the beauchamps drawing - room]1935-their drawing - room window , a little shaded by the muslin curtains , watching the busy preparations for the marriage , which was to take place the next day . All morning long , hampers of fruit and flowers , boxes from the railway -- for by this time [East Chester]33-east chester had got a railway -- shop messengers , [hired assistants]1936-hired assistants , kept passing backwards and forwards in [the busy Close]1937-the busy close . Towards afternoon the bustle subsided , the scaffolding was up , the materials for the next day 's feast carried out of sight . It was to be concluded that [the bride elect]1938-the bride elect was seeing to the packing of [[her]1938-the bride elect trousseau]1939-her trousseau , helped by [the merry multitude of cousins]1940-the merry multitude of cousins , and that [the servants]1099-the servants were arranging the dinner for the day , or the breakfast for the morrow . So [Miss Monro]77-miss monro had settled it , discussing every detail and every probability as though [she]77-miss monro were [a chief actor]1942-a chief actor , instead of only [a distant , uncared - for spectator of the coming event]1943-a distant , uncared - for spectator of the coming event . [Ellinor]73-ellinor was tired , and now that there was nothing interesting going on , [she]73-ellinor had fallen back to [her]73-ellinor sewing , when [she]73-ellinor was startled by [Miss Memo]162-miss memo 's exclamation : " Look , look ! here are [two gentlemen]3051-two gentlemen coming along the lime - tree walk ! it must be [the bridegroom]3052-the bridegroom and [[his]3052-the bridegroom friend]3053-his friend . "[162-miss memo] Out of much sympathy , and some curiosity , [Ellinor]73-ellinor bent forward , and saw , just emerging from the shadow of the trees on to the full afternoon sunlit pavement , [Mr. Corbet]81-mr. corbet and [another gentleman]1944-another gentleman ; [the former]1067-the former changed , worn , aged , though with still the same fine intellectual face , leaning on the arm of [the younger taller man]1946-the younger taller man , and talking eagerly . [The other gentleman]1947-the other gentleman was doubtless [the bridegroom]3052-the bridegroom , [Ellinor]73-ellinor said to [herself]73-ellinor ; and yet [her]73-ellinor prophetic heart did not believe [her]73-ellinor words . Even before [the bright beauty at the deanery]1949-the bright beauty at the deanery looked out of the great oriel window of [the drawing - room]573-the drawing - room , and blushed , and smiled , and kissed [her]73-ellinor hand -- a gesture replied to by [Mr. Corbet]81-mr. corbet with much _ empressement _ , while [the other man]1951-the other man only took off [his]1951-the other man hat , almost as if [he]1951-the other man saw [her]73-ellinor there for the first time -- [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's greedy eyes watched [him]1951-the other man till [he]1951-the other man was hidden from sight in [the deanery]3040-the deanery , unheeding [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's eager incoherent sentences , in turn entreating , apologising , comforting , and upbraiding . Then [she]73-ellinor slowly turned [her]73-ellinor painful eyes upon [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's face , and moved [her]73-ellinor lips without a sound being heard , and fainted dead away . In all [her]73-ellinor life [she]73-ellinor had never done so before , and when [she]73-ellinor came round [she]73-ellinor was not like [herself]73-ellinor ; in all probability the persistence and wilfulness [she]73-ellinor , who was usually so meek and docile , showed during the next twenty - four hours , was the consequence of fever . [She]73-ellinor resolved to be present at the wedding ; numbers were going ; [she]73-ellinor would be unseen , unnoticed in [the crowd]1953-the crowd ; but whatever befell , go [she]73-ellinor would , and neither the tears nor the prayers of [Miss Monro]77-miss monro could keep [her]73-ellinor back . [She]73-ellinor gave no reason for this determination ; indeed , in all probability [she]73-ellinor had none to give ; so there was no arguing the point . [She]73-ellinor was inflexible to entreaty , and [no one]385-no one had any authority over [her]73-ellinor , except , perhaps , distant [Mr. Ness]80-mr. ness . [Miss Monro]77-miss monro had all sorts of forebodings as to the possible scenes that might come to pass . But all went on as quietly as though the fullest sympathy pervaded [every individual of the great numbers assembled]1955-every individual of the great numbers assembled . [No one]385-no one guessed that [the muffled , veiled figure]1957-the muffled , veiled figure , sitting in the shadow behind one of the great pillars , was that of one who had once hoped to stand at the altar with [the same bridegroom]1958-the same bridegroom , who now cast tender looks at [the beautiful bride]1959-the beautiful bride ; [her]1959-the beautiful bride veil white and fairy - like , [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's black and shrouding as that of [any nun]1960-any nun . [Already Mr. Corbet]81-mr. corbet 's name was known through [the country]430-the country as that of [a great lawyer]1962-a great lawyer ; [people]446-people discussed [his]1962-a great lawyer speeches and character far and wide ; and [the well - informed in legal gossip]1964-the well - informed in legal gossip spoke of [him]1962-a great lawyer as sure to be offered a judgeship at the next vacancy . So [he]1962-a great lawyer , though grave , and middle - aged , and somewhat grey , divided attention and remark with [[his]1962-a great lawyer lovely bride]1965-his lovely bride , and [[her]1965-his lovely bride pretty train of [cousin bridesmaids]1967-cousin bridesmaids]1966-her pretty train of cousin bridesmaids . [Miss Monro]77-miss monro need not have feared for [Ellinor]73-ellinor : [she]77-miss monro saw and heard all things as in a mist -- a dream ; as something [she]77-miss monro had to go through , before [she]77-miss monro could waken up to a reality of brightness in which [her]77-miss monro youth , and the hopes of [her]77-miss monro youth , should be restored , and all these weary years of dreaminess and woe should be revealed as nothing but the nightmare of a night . [She]73-ellinor sat motionless enough , still enough , [Miss Monro]77-miss monro by [her]73-ellinor , watching [her]73-ellinor as intently as [a keeper]1968-a keeper watches [a madman , and with the same purpose]1969-a madman , and with the same purpose -- to prevent any outburst even by bodily strength , if such restraint be needed . When all was over ; when [the principal personages of the ceremony]1970-the principal personages of the ceremony had filed into [the vestry]1971-the vestry to sign [their]1970-the principal personages of the ceremony names ; when the swarm of [townspeople]1972-townspeople were going out as swiftly as [their]1970-the principal personages of the ceremony individual notions of the restraints of the sacred edifice permitted ; when the great chords of the " Wedding March "[73-ellinor] clanged out from the organ , and the loud bells pealed overhead -- [Ellinor]73-ellinor laid [her]73-ellinor hand in [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's . " Take [me]73-ellinor [home]230-home , "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor said softly . And [Miss Monro]77-miss monro led [her]77-miss monro [home]230-home as one leads [the blind]1974-the blind . CHAPTER XII . There are [some people who imperceptibly float away from [their]1975-some people who imperceptibly float away from their youth into middle age , and thence pass into declining life with the soft and gentle motion of happy years youth into middle age , and thence pass into declining life with the soft and gentle motion of happy years]1975-some people who imperceptibly float away from their youth into middle age , and thence pass into declining life with the soft and gentle motion of happy years . There are others who are whirled , in spite of [themselves]1975-some people who imperceptibly float away from their youth into middle age , and thence pass into declining life with the soft and gentle motion of happy years , down dizzy rapids of agony away from [their]1975-some people who imperceptibly float away from their youth into middle age , and thence pass into declining life with the soft and gentle motion of happy years youth at one great bound , into old age with another sudden shock ; and thence into the vast calm ocean where there are no shore - marks to tell of time . This last , it seemed , was to be [[Ellinor]73-ellinor 's lot]1976-ellinor 's lot . [Her]73-ellinor youth had gone in a single night , fifteen years ago , and now [she]73-ellinor appeared to have become [an elderly woman ; very still and hopeless in look and movement]1977-an elderly woman ; very still and hopeless in look and movement , but as sweet and gentle in speech and smile as ever [she]73-ellinor had been in [her]73-ellinor happiest days . [All young people]1978-all young people , when [they]1978-all young people came to know [her]73-ellinor , loved [her]73-ellinor dearly , though at first [they]1978-all young people might call [her]73-ellinor dull , and heavy to get on with ; and as for [children]426-children and [old people]1980-old people , [her]73-ellinor ready watchful sympathy in [their]1978-all young people joys as well as [their]1978-all young people sorrows was an unfailing passage to [their]1978-all young people hearts . After the first great shock of [Mr. Corbet]81-mr. corbet 's marriage was over , [she]73-ellinor seemed to pass into a greater peace than [she]73-ellinor had known for years ; the last faint hope of happiness was gone ; it would , perhaps , be more accurate to say , of the bright happiness [she]73-ellinor had planned for [herself]73-ellinor in [her]73-ellinor early youth . Unconsciously , [she]73-ellinor was being weaned from self - seeking in any shape , and [her]73-ellinor daily life became , if possible , more innocent and pure and holy . [One of [the canons]1756-the canons]1981-one of the canons used to laugh at [her]73-ellinor for [her]73-ellinor constant attendance at all the services , and for [her]73-ellinor devotion to good works , and call [her]73-ellinor always [the reverend sister]1983-the reverend sister . [Miss Monro]77-miss monro was a little annoyed at this faint clerical joke ; [Ellinor]73-ellinor smiled quietly . [Miss Monro]77-miss monro disapproved of [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's grave ways and sober severe style of dress . " [You]73-ellinor may be as good as [you]73-ellinor like , [[my]77-miss monro dear]2732-my dear , and yet go dressed in some pretty colour , instead of those perpetual blacks and greys , and then there would be no need for [me]77-miss monro to be perpetually telling [people]446-people [you]73-ellinor are only four - and - thirty ( and [they]446-people do n't believe [me]77-miss monro , though [I]77-miss monro tell [them]446-people so till [I]77-miss monro am black in the face ) . Or , if [you]73-ellinor would but wear a decent - shaped bonnet , instead of always wearing those of the poky shape in fashion when [you]73-ellinor were seventeen . "[77-miss monro] [The old canon]1984-the old canon died , and [some one]1211-some one was to be appointed in [his]1984-the old canon stead . These clerical preferments and appointments were the all - important interests to [the inhabitants of [the Close]1771-the close]1986-the inhabitants of the close , and the discussion of probabilities came up invariably if [any two]1988-any two met together , in [street]1989-street or [house]1990-house , or even in [the very cathedral itself]1991-the very cathedral itself . At length it was settled , and announced by [the higher powers]1992-the higher powers . [An energetic , hard - working clergyman from [a distant part of [the diocese]1995-the diocese]1994-a distant part of the diocese , [Livingstone]114-herbert livingstone by name]1993-an energetic , hard - working clergyman from a distant part of the diocese , livingstone by name , was to have [the vacant canonry]1996-the vacant canonry . [Miss Monro]77-miss monro said that the name was somehow familiar to [her]77-miss monro , and by degrees [she]77-miss monro recollected [the young curate who had come to inquire after [Ellinor]73-ellinor in that dreadful illness [she]77-miss monro had had at [Hamley]1-hamley in the year 1829]1997-the young curate who had come to inquire after ellinor in that dreadful illness she had had at hamley in the year 1829 . [Ellinor]73-ellinor knew nothing of that visit ; no more than [Miss Monro]77-miss monro did of what had passed between [the two]807-the two before that anxious night . [Ellinor]73-ellinor just thought it possible it might be the same [Mr. Livingstone]112-mr. livingstone , and would rather it were not , because [she]73-ellinor did not feel as if [she]73-ellinor could bear the frequent though not intimate intercourse [she]73-ellinor must needs have , if such were the case , with one so closely associated with that great time of terror which [she]73-ellinor was striving to bury out of sight by every effort in [her]73-ellinor power . [Miss Monro]77-miss monro , on the contrary , was busy weaving a romance for [[her]77-miss monro pupil]1717-her pupil ; [she]77-miss monro thought of the passionate interest displayed by [the fair young clergyman fifteen years ago]2000-the fair young clergyman fifteen years ago , and believed that occasionally [men]857-men could be constant , and hoped that if [Mr. Livingstone]112-mr. livingstone were the new canon , [he]112-mr. livingstone might prove the _ rara avis _ which exists but once in a century . [He]112-mr. livingstone came , and it was the same . [He]112-mr. livingstone looked a little stouter , a little older , but had still the gait and aspect of [a young man]543-a young man . [His]112-mr. livingstone smooth fair face was scarcely lined at all with any marks of care ; the blue eyes looked so kindly and peaceful , that [Miss Monro]77-miss monro could scarcely fancy they were the same which [she]77-miss monro had seen fast filling with tears ; the bland calm look of [the whole man]2003-the whole man needed the ennoblement of [his]112-mr. livingstone evident devoutness to be raised into the type of holy innocence which some of [the Romanists]2004-the romanists call the " sacerdotal face . "[112-mr. livingstone] [His]112-mr. livingstone entire soul was in [his]112-mr. livingstone work , and [he]112-mr. livingstone looked as little likely to step forth in the character of either [a hero of romance]2005-a hero of romance or [a faithful lover as could be imagined]2006-a faithful lover as could be imagined . Still [Miss Monro]77-miss monro was not discouraged ; [she]77-miss monro remembered the warm , passionate feeling [she]77-miss monro had once seen break through the calm exterior , and [she]77-miss monro believed that what had happened once might occur again . Of course , while all eyes were directed on the new canon , [he]112-mr. livingstone had to learn who [the possessors of those eyes]2007-the possessors of those eyes were one by one ; and it was probably some time before the idea came into [his]112-mr. livingstone mind that [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins , [the lady in black , with the sad pale face]2008-the lady in black , with the sad pale face , so constant [an attendant at service]2009-an attendant at service , so regular [a visitor at [the school]2011-the school]2010-a visitor at the school , was the same [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins as the bright vision of [his]112-mr. livingstone youth . It was [her]106-miss wilkins sweet smile at [a painstaking child that betrayed [her]106-miss wilkins]2012-a painstaking child that betrayed her -- if , indeed , betrayal it might be called where there was no wish or effort to conceal anything . [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone left [the schoolroom]788-the schoolroom almost directly , and , after being for an hour or so in [[his]163-canon livingstone house]552-his house , went out to call on [Mrs. Randall]164-mrs. randall , [the person who knew more of [[her]164-mrs. randall neighbours]2016-her neighbours ' affairs than [any one in [East Chester]33-east chester]2017-any one in east chester]2015-the person who knew more of her neighbours ' affairs than any one in east chester . The next day [he]163-canon livingstone called on [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins [herself]106-miss wilkins . [She]106-miss wilkins would have been very glad if [he]163-canon livingstone had kept on in [his]163-canon livingstone ignorance ; it was so keenly painful to be in the company of [one the sight of whom , even at a distance]2018-one the sight of whom , even at a distance , had brought [her]106-miss wilkins such a keen remembrance of past misery ; and when told of [his]163-canon livingstone call , as [she]106-miss wilkins was sitting at [her]106-miss wilkins sewing in [the dining - room]745-the dining - room , [she]106-miss wilkins had to nerve [herself]106-miss wilkins for the interview before going [upstairs]1175-upstairs into [the drawing - room]573-the drawing - room , where [he]163-canon livingstone was being entertained by [Miss Monro]77-miss monro with warm demonstrations of welcome . A little contraction of the brow , a little compression of the lips , an increased pallor on [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's part , was all that [Miss Monro]77-miss monro could see in [her]106-miss wilkins , though [she]106-miss wilkins had put on [her]106-miss wilkins glasses with foresight and intention to observe . [She]106-miss wilkins turned to [the canon]1848-the canon ; [his]1848-the canon colour had certainly deepened as [he]1848-the canon went forwards with out - stretched hand to meet [Ellinor]73-ellinor . That was all that was to be seen ; but on the slight foundation of that blush , [Miss Monro]77-miss monro built [many castles]2023-many castles ; and when they faded away , one after one , [she]106-miss wilkins recognised that they were only baseless visions . [She]106-miss wilkins used to put the disappointment of [her]106-miss wilkins hopes down to [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's unvaried calmness of demeanour , which might be taken for coldness of disposition ; and to [her]106-miss wilkins steady refusal to allow [Miss Monro]77-miss monro to invite [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone to the small teas [they]2024-they were in the habit of occasionally giving . Yet [he]163-canon livingstone persevered in [his]163-canon livingstone calls ; about once every fortnight [he]163-canon livingstone came , and would sit an hour or more , looking covertly at [his]163-canon livingstone watch , as if as [Miss Monro]77-miss monro shrewdly observed to [herself]77-miss monro , [he]163-canon livingstone did not go away at last because [he]163-canon livingstone wished to do so , but because [he]163-canon livingstone ought . Sometimes [Ellinor]73-ellinor was present , sometimes [she]77-miss monro was away ; in this latter case [Miss Monro]77-miss monro thought [she]77-miss monro could detect a certain wistful watching of the door every time a noise was heard outside [the room]479-the room . [He]163-canon livingstone always avoided any reference to former days at [Hamley]1-hamley , and that , [Miss Monro]77-miss monro feared , was a bad sign . After this long uniformity of years without any event closely touching on [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's own individual life , with the one great exception of [Mr. Corbet]81-mr. corbet 's marriage , something happened which much affected [her]73-ellinor . [Mr. Ness]80-mr. ness died suddenly at [[his]80-mr. ness parsonage]2026-his parsonage , and [Ellinor]73-ellinor learnt it first from [Mr. Brown]152-mr. brown , [a clergyman , whose living was near [Hamley]1-hamley]2027-a clergyman , whose living was near hamley , and who had been sent for by [the Parsonage servants]2028-the parsonage servants as soon as [they]2028-the parsonage servants discovered that it was not sleep , but death , that made [[their]2028-the parsonage servants master]1472-their master so late in rising . [Mr. Brown]152-mr. brown had been appointed [executer]2030-executer by [[his]152-mr. brown late friend]2031-his late friend , and wrote to tell [Ellinor]73-ellinor that after a few legacies were paid , [she]73-ellinor was to have a life- interest in the remainder of [the small property which [Mr. Ness]80-mr. ness had left]2032-the small property which mr. ness had left , and that it would be necessary for [her]73-ellinor , as [the residuary legatee]2033-the residuary legatee , to come to [Hamley Parsonage]41-hamley parsonage as soon as convenient , to decide upon certain courses of action with regard to furniture , books , & amp;c . [Ellinor]73-ellinor shrank from this journey , which [her]73-ellinor love and duty towards [[her]73-ellinor dead friend]2034-her dead friend rendered necessary . [She]73-ellinor had scarcely left [East Chester]33-east chester since [she]73-ellinor first arrived [there]538-there , sixteen or seventeen years ago , and [she]73-ellinor was timorous about the very mode of travelling ; and then to go back to [Hamley]1-hamley , which [she]73-ellinor thought never to have seen again ! [She]73-ellinor never spoke much about any feelings of [her]73-ellinor own , but [Miss Monro]77-miss monro could always read [her]73-ellinor silence , and interpreted it into pretty just and forcible words that afternoon when [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone called . [She]73-ellinor liked to talk about [Ellinor]73-ellinor to [him]163-canon livingstone , and suspected that [he]163-canon livingstone liked to hear . [She]73-ellinor was almost annoyed this time by the comfort [he]163-canon livingstone would keep giving [her]73-ellinor ; there was no greater danger in travelling by [railroad]2036-railroad than by [coach]2037-coach , a little care about certain things was required , that was all , and the average number of deaths by accidents on [railroads]2038-railroads was not greater than the average number when [people]446-people travelled by [coach]2037-coach , if [you]2041-you took into consideration the far greater number of [travellers]2042-travellers . Yes ! returning to the deserted scenes of [one]2715-one 's youth was very painful . . . Had [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins made any provision for [another lady]2044-another lady to take [her]73-ellinor place as [visitor at [the school]2011-the school]2045-visitor at the school ? [He]163-canon livingstone believed it was [her]73-ellinor week . [Miss Monro]77-miss monro was out of all patience at [his]163-canon livingstone entire calmness and reasonableness . Later in the day [she]73-ellinor became more at peace with [him]163-canon livingstone , when [she]73-ellinor received a kind little note from [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes , [a great friend of [hers]73-ellinor]2047-a great friend of hers , and [the mother of [the family [she]73-ellinor was now teaching]2049-the family she was now teaching]2048-the mother of the family she was now teaching , saying that [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone had called and told [her]73-ellinor that [Ellinor]73-ellinor had to go on a very painful journey , and that [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes was quite sure [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's companionship upon it would be a great comfort to [both]590-both , and that [she]73-ellinor could perfectly be set at liberty for a fortnight or so , for it would fall in admirably with the fact that " [Jeanie]166-jeanie was growing tall , and [the doctor]348-the doctor had advised [sea]3058-sea air this spring ; so a month 's holiday would suit [them]590-both now even better than later on . "[73-ellinor] Was this going straight to [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes , to whom [she]73-ellinor should [herself]73-ellinor scarcely have liked to name it , the act of [a good , thoughtful man]2051-a good , thoughtful man , or of [a lover]2052-a lover ? questioned [Miss Monro]77-miss monro ; but [she]77-miss monro could not answer [her]77-miss monro own inquiry , and had to be very grateful for the deed , without accounting for the motives . [A coach]2053-a coach met [the train]2054-the train at [a station about ten miles from [Hamley]1-hamley]2055-a station about ten miles from hamley , and [Dixon]86-dixon was at [the inn]2056-the inn where [the coach]2057-the coach stopped , ready to receive [them]2058-them . [The old man]1080-the old man was almost in tears at the sight of [them]2058-them again in [a familiar place]2060-a familiar place . [He]1080-the old man had put on [his]1080-the old man Sunday clothes to do [them]2058-them honour ; and to conceal [his]1080-the old man agitation [he]1080-the old man kept up a pretended bustle about [their]2058-them luggage . To the indignation of [the inn - porters , who were of a later generation]2061-the inn - porters , who were of a later generation , [he]1080-the old man would wheel it [himself]1080-the old man to [the Parsonage]581-the parsonage , though [he]1080-the old man broke down from fatigue once or twice on the way , and had to stand and rest , [[his]1080-the old man ladies]2063-his ladies waiting by [his]1080-the old man side , and making remarks on the alterations of [houses]2064-houses and [the places of trees]2065-the places of trees , in order to give [him]1080-the old man ample time to recruit [himself]1080-the old man , for there was [no one]385-no one to wait for [them]2061-the inn - porters , who were of a later generation and give [them]2061-the inn - porters , who were of a later generation a welcome to [the Parsonage]581-the parsonage , which was to be [[their]2061-the inn - porters , who were of a later generation temporary home]2068-their temporary home . [The respectful servants , in deep mourning]2069-the respectful servants , in deep mourning , had all prepared , and gave [Ellinor]73-ellinor a note from [Mr. Brown]152-mr. brown , saying that [he]1080-the old man purposely refrained from disturbing [them]2061-the inn - porters , who were of a later generation that day after [their]2061-the inn - porters , who were of a later generation long journey , but would call on the morrow , and tell [them]2061-the inn - porters , who were of a later generation of the arrangements [he]1080-the old man had thought of making , always subject to [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins 's approval . These were simple enough ; certain legal forms to be gone through , any selection from books or furniture to be made , and the rest to be sold by auction as speedily as convenient , as [the successor to the living]2070-the successor to the living might wish to have repairs and alterations effected in [the old parsonage]2071-the old parsonage . For some days [Ellinor]73-ellinor employed [herself]73-ellinor in business in [the house]761-the house , never going out except to [church]1461-church . [Miss Monro]77-miss monro , on the contrary , strolled about everywhere , noticing all the alterations in place and [people]446-people , which were never improvements in [her]77-miss monro opinion . [Ellinor]73-ellinor had [plenty of callers]2075-plenty of callers ( [[her]73-ellinor tenants]2076-her tenants , [Mr.]2077-mr. and [Mrs. Osbaldistone]167-mrs. osbaldistone among others ) , but , excepting in rare cases -- most of [them]2075-plenty of callers belonged to humble life -- [she]73-ellinor declined to see every one , as [she]73-ellinor had business enough on [her]73-ellinor hands : sixteen years makes a great difference in [any set of [people]446-people]2078-any set of people . [The old acquaintances of [[her]73-ellinor father]398-her father in [his]398-her father better days]2080-the old acquaintances of her father in his better days were almost all dead or removed ; there were [one or two remaining]2082-one or two remaining , and these [Ellinor]73-ellinor received ; [one or two more , old and infirm , confined to [[their]2084-their houses]1377-their houses , [she]73-ellinor planned to call upon before leaving [Hamley]1-hamley]2083-one or two more , old and infirm , confined to their houses , she planned to call upon before leaving hamley . Every evening , when [Dixon]86-dixon had done [his]86-dixon work at [[Mr. Osbaldistone]145-mr. osbaldistone 's]2086-mr. osbaldistone 's , [he]86-dixon came up to [the Parsonage]581-the parsonage , ostensibly to help [her]73-ellinor in moving or packing books , but really because [these two]2088-these two clung to each other -- were bound to each other by a bond never to be spoken about . It was understood between [them]2088-these two that once before [Ellinor]73-ellinor left [she]73-ellinor should go and see [the old place]1098-the old place , [Ford Bank]15-ford bank . Not to go into [the house]761-the house , though [Mr.]2091-mr. and [Mrs. Osbaldistone]167-mrs. osbaldistone had begged [her]73-ellinor to name [her]73-ellinor own time for revisiting it when [they]2088-these two and [[their]2088-these two family]2724-their family would be absent , but to see all [the gardens and grounds]2093-the gardens and grounds once more ; a solemn , miserable visit , which , because of the very misery it involved , appeared to [Ellinor]73-ellinor to be an imperative duty . [Dixon]86-dixon and [she]73-ellinor talked together as [she]73-ellinor sat making a catalogue one evening in [the old low - browed library]2094-the old low - browed library ; the casement windows were open into [the garden]711-the garden , and the May showers had brought out the scents of the new - leaved sweetbriar bush just below . Beyond [the garden]711-the garden hedge [the grassy meadows]2097-the grassy meadows sloped away down to [the river]1441-the river ; [the Parsonage]581-the parsonage was so much raised that , sitting in [the house]761-the house , [you]2101-you could see over the boundary hedge . [Men with instruments]2102-men with instruments were busy in [the meadow]2103-the meadow . [Ellinor]73-ellinor , pausing in [her]73-ellinor work , asked [Dixon]86-dixon what [they]2088-these two were doing . " [Them]2088-these two 's [the people]1367-the people for [the new railway]3060-the new railway , "[86-dixon] said [he]86-dixon . " Nought would satisfy [the Hamley folk]3061-the hamley folk but to have a railway all to [themselves]3061-the hamley folk -- [coaches]3062-coaches is n't good enough now - a - days . "[86-dixon] [He]86-dixon spoke with a tone of personal offence natural to [a man who had passed all [his]86-dixon life among horses , and considered railway - engines as [[their]2088-these two despicable rivals]2105-their despicable rivals , conquering only by stratagem]2104-a man who had passed all his life among horses , and considered railway - engines as their despicable rivals , conquering only by stratagem . By - and - by [Ellinor]73-ellinor passed on to a subject the consideration of which [she]73-ellinor had repeatedly urged upon [Dixon]86-dixon , and entreated [him]86-dixon to come and form one of [[their]2088-these two household at [East Chester]33-east chester]2106-their household at east chester . [He]86-dixon was growing old , [she]73-ellinor thought older even in looks and feelings than in years , and [she]73-ellinor would make [him]86-dixon happy and comfortable in [his]86-dixon declining years if [he]86-dixon would but come and pass [them]2107-them under [her]73-ellinor care . The addition which [Mr. Ness]80-mr. ness 's bequest made to [her]73-ellinor income would enable [her]73-ellinor to do not only this , but to relieve [Miss Monro]77-miss monro of [her]73-ellinor occupation of teaching ; which , at the years [she]73-ellinor had arrived at , was becoming burdensome . When [she]73-ellinor proposed the removal to [Dixon]86-dixon [he]86-dixon shook [his]86-dixon head . " It 's not that [I]86-dixon do n't thank [you]73-ellinor , and kindly , too ; but [I]86-dixon 'm too old to go chopping and changing . "[86-dixon] " But it would be no change to come back to [me]73-ellinor , [Dixon]86-dixon , "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor . " Yes , it would . [I]73-ellinor were born [i]73-ellinor ' [Hamley]1-hamley , and it 's [i]73-ellinor ' [Hamley]1-hamley [I]73-ellinor reckon to die . "[73-ellinor] On [her]73-ellinor urging [him]86-dixon a little more , it came out that [he]86-dixon had a strong feeling that if [he]86-dixon did not watch the spot where [the dead man]1223-the dead man lay buried , the whole would be discovered ; and that this dread of [his]86-dixon had often poisoned the pleasure of [his]86-dixon visit to [East Chester]33-east chester . " [I]73-ellinor do n't rightly know how it is , for [I]73-ellinor sometimes think if it was n't for [you]73-ellinor , [missy]3009-missy , [I]73-ellinor should be glad to have made it all clear before [I]73-ellinor go ; and yet at times [I]73-ellinor dream , or it comes into [my]73-ellinor head as [I]73-ellinor lie awake with the rheumatics , that [some one]1211-some one is there , digging ; or that [I]73-ellinor hear 'em cutting down the tree ; and then [I]73-ellinor get up and look out of the loft window -- you'll mind the window over [the stables]783-the stables , as looks into [the garden]711-the garden , all covered over wi ' the leaves of the jargonelle pear - tree ? "[73-ellinor] [Ellinor]73-ellinor shivered a little . [He]2109-i saw it , and restrained [himself]2109-i in the relief [he]2109-i was receiving from imparting [his]2109-i superstitious fancies . " [You]3070-you see , [missy]3009-missy , [I]2109-i could never rest a - nights if [I]2109-i did n't feel as if [I]2109-i kept the secret in [my]2109-i hand , and held it tight day and night , so as [I]2109-i could open [my]2109-i hand at any minute and see as it was there . No ! [[my]2109-i own little missy]3072-my own little missy will let [me]2109-i come and see [her]3072-my own little missy now and again , and [I]2109-i know as [I]2109-i can allays ask [her]3072-my own little missy for what [I]2109-i want : and if it please [God]119-god to lay [me]2109-i by , [I]2109-i shall tell [her]3072-my own little missy so , and [she]3072-my own little missy 'll see as [I]2109-i want for nothing . "[2109-i] " Do n't talk so , please , [Dixon]86-dixon , "[2110-she] said [she]2110-she . "[2111-i] [He]2111-i was going out of [the room]479-the room , and was now more talking to [himself]2111-i than to [her]2110-she . " [They]3074-they say blood will out , and if it were n't for [her]2110-she part in it , [I]2111-i could wish for a clear breast before [I]2111-i die . "[2111-i] [She]2110-she did not hear the latter part of this mumbled sentence . [She]2110-she was looking at a letter just brought in and requiring an immediate answer . It was from [Mr. Brown]152-mr. brown . Notes from [him]152-mr. brown were of daily occurrence , but this contained an open letter the writing of which was strangely familiar to [her]2110-she -- it did not need the signature " [Ralph Corbet]81-mr. corbet , "[152-mr. brown] to tell [her]2110-she whom the letter came from . For some moments [she]2110-she could not read the words . [They]2113-they expressed a simple enough request , and were addressed to [the auctioneer who was to dispose of [the rather valuable library of [the late Mr. Ness]80-mr. ness]2115-the rather valuable library of the late mr. ness , and whose name had been advertised in connection with the sale , in [the _ Athenaeum _]2116-the _ athenaeum _ , and other similar papers]2114-the auctioneer who was to dispose of the rather valuable library of the late mr. ness , and whose name had been advertised in connection with the sale , in the _ athenaeum _ , and other similar papers . To [him]152-mr. brown [Mr. Corbet]81-mr. corbet wrote , saying that [he]152-mr. brown should be unable to be present when the books were sold , but that [he]152-mr. brown wished to be allowed to buy in , at any price decided upon , a certain rare folio edition of _ Virgil _ , bound in parchment , and with notes in Italian . The book was fully described . Though [no Latin scholar]2117-no latin scholar , [Ellinor]73-ellinor knew the book well -- remembered its look from old times , and could instantly have laid [her]73-ellinor hand upon it . [The auctioneer]2118-the auctioneer had sent the request onto [[his]2118-the auctioneer employer]675-his employer , [Mr. Brown]152-mr. brown . [That gentleman]2120-that gentleman applied to [Ellinor]73-ellinor for [her]73-ellinor consent . [She]73-ellinor saw that the fact of the intended sale must be all that [Mr. Corbet]81-mr. corbet was aware of , and that [he]81-mr. corbet could not know to whom the books belonged . [She]73-ellinor chose out the book , and wrapped and tied it up with trembling hands . _ [He]81-mr. corbet _ might be [the person to untie the knot]2121-the person to untie the knot . It was strangely familiar to [her]73-ellinor love , after so many years , to be brought into thus much contact with [him]81-mr. corbet . [She]73-ellinor wrote a short note to [Mr. Brown]152-mr. brown , in which [she]73-ellinor requested [him]81-mr. corbet to say , as though from [himself]81-mr. corbet ; and without any mention of [her]73-ellinor name , that [he]81-mr. corbet , as executor , requested [Mr. Corbet]81-mr. corbet 's acceptance of the _ Virgil _ , as a remembrance of [[his]81-mr. corbet former friend and tutor]2122-his former friend and tutor . Then [she]73-ellinor rang the bell , and gave the letter and parcel to [the servant]1239-the servant . Again alone , and [Mr. Corbet]81-mr. corbet 's open letter on the table . [She]73-ellinor took it up and looked at it till the letters dazzled crimson on the white paper . [Her]73-ellinor life rolled backwards , and [she]73-ellinor was [a girl]390-a girl again . At last [she]73-ellinor roused [herself]73-ellinor ; but instead of destroying the note -- it was long years since all [her]73-ellinor love - letters from [him]81-mr. corbet had been returned to [the writer]2125-the writer -- [she]73-ellinor unlocked [her]73-ellinor little writing - case again , and placed this letter carefully down at the bottom , among the dead rose - leaves which embalmed the note from [[her]73-ellinor father]398-her father , found after [his]398-her father death under [his]398-her father pillow , the little golden curl of [[her]73-ellinor sister]2127-her sister 's , the half - finished sewing of [[her]73-ellinor mother]458-her mother . The shabby writing - case itself was given [her]73-ellinor by [[her]73-ellinor father]398-her father long ago , and had since been taken with [her]73-ellinor everywhere . To be sure , [her]73-ellinor changes of place had been but few ; but if [she]73-ellinor had gone to [Nova Zembla]42-nova zembla , the sight of that little leather box on awaking from [her]73-ellinor first sleep , would have given [her]73-ellinor a sense of [home]230-home . [She]73-ellinor locked the case up again , and felt all the richer for that morning . A day or two afterwards [she]73-ellinor left [Hamley]1-hamley . Before [she]73-ellinor went [she]73-ellinor compelled [herself]73-ellinor to go round [[the gardens]3014-the gardens and grounds of [Ford Bank]15-ford bank]2132-the gardens and grounds of ford bank . " [You]73-ellinor see how literally [we]3075-we have obeyed the clause in the lease which ties [us]3075-we out from any alterations , "[145-mr. osbaldistone] said [he]145-mr. osbaldistone , smiling . " [We]3075-we are living in [a tangled thicket of wood]3076-a tangled thicket of wood . [She]73-ellinor felt as if , with all [her]73-ellinor striving , [she]73-ellinor could not move -- just as one does in a nightmare -- but [she]73-ellinor was past [the place]1296-the place even as this terror came to its acme ; and when [she]73-ellinor came to [herself]73-ellinor , [Mr. Osbaldistone]145-mr. osbaldistone was still blandly talking , and saying-- " It is now a reward for [our]2134-our obedience to [your]73-ellinor wishes , [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins , for if [the projected railway]3086-the projected railway passes through [the ash - field yonder]3087-the ash - field yonder [we]2134-our should have been perpetually troubled with the sight of [the trains]3088-the trains ; indeed , the sound would have been much more distinct than it will be now coming through the interlacing branches . "[145-mr. osbaldistone] [Ellinor]73-ellinor grasped eagerly at the only pleasure which [her]73-ellinor money enabled [her]73-ellinor to give to [the old man]1080-the old man : and promised [him]1080-the old man that [she]73-ellinor would take care and buy the right to [that particular piece of ground]2145-that particular piece of ground . "[1080-the old man] It was a much more easy affair to give [Miss Monro]77-miss monro some additional comforts ; [she]77-miss monro was as cheerful as ever ; still working away at [her]77-miss monro languages in any spare time , but confessing that [she]77-miss monro was tired of the perpetual teaching in which [her]77-miss monro life had been spent during the last thirty years . [Ellinor]73-ellinor was now enabled to set [her]73-ellinor at liberty from this , and [she]73-ellinor accepted the kindness from [[her]73-ellinor former pupil]2148-her former pupil with as much simple gratitude as that with which [a mother]2149-a mother receives a favour from [a child]584-a child . " If [Ellinor]73-ellinor were but married to [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone , [I]73-ellinor should be happier than [I]73-ellinor have ever been since [[my]73-ellinor father]2646-my father died , "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor used to say to [herself]73-ellinor in the solitude of [[her]73-ellinor bed - chamber]1176-her bed - chamber , for talking aloud had become [her]73-ellinor wo nt in the early years of [her]73-ellinor isolated life as [a governess]2607-a governess . " And yet , "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor went on , " [I]73-ellinor do n't know what [I]73-ellinor should do without [her]73-ellinor ; it is lucky for [me]73-ellinor that things are not in [my]73-ellinor hands , for a pretty mess [I]73-ellinor should make of them , one way or another . [Dear]2849-dear ! how old [Mrs. Cadogan]169-mrs. cadogan used to hate that word ' mess , ' and correct [[her]169-mrs. cadogan granddaughters]3100-her granddaughters for using it right before [my]73-ellinor face , when [I]73-ellinor knew [I]73-ellinor had said it [myself]73-ellinor only the moment before ! Well ! those days are all over now . [God]119-god be thanked ! "[73-ellinor] In spite of being glad that " things were not in [her]77-miss monro hands "[77-miss monro] [Miss Monro]77-miss monro tried to take affairs into [her]77-miss monro charge by doing all [she]77-miss monro could to persuade [Ellinor]73-ellinor to allow [her]77-miss monro to invite [the canon]1848-the canon to [their]2154-their " little sociable teas . "[77-miss monro] The most provoking part was , that [she]77-miss monro was sure [he]1848-the canon would have come if [he]1848-the canon had been asked ; but [she]77-miss monro could never get leave to do so . " Of course [no man]2727-no man could go on for ever and ever without encouragement , "[77-miss monro] as [she]77-miss monro confided to [herself]77-miss monro in a plaintive tone of voice ; and by - and - by many [people]446-people were led to suppose that [the bachelor canon]2156-the bachelor canon was paying attention to [Miss Forbes]170-miss forbes , [the eldest daughter of [the family to which [the delicate Jeanie]166-jeanie belonged]2158-the family to which the delicate jeanie belonged]2157-the eldest daughter of the family to which the delicate jeanie belonged . It was , perhaps , with [the Forbeses]171-the forbeses that both [Miss Monro]77-miss monro and [Ellinor]73-ellinor were [the most intimate of [all the families in [East Chester]33-east chester]2160-all the families in east chester]2159-the most intimate of all the families in east chester . [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes was [a widow lady of good means]2161-a widow lady of good means , with [a large family of pretty , delicate daughters]2162-a large family of pretty , delicate daughters . [She]77-miss monro [herself]77-miss monro belonged to [one of [the great houses in ---shire]2164-the great houses in ---shire]2163-one of the great houses in ---shire , but had married into [Scotland]10-scotland ; so , after [[her]77-miss monro husband]407-her husband 's death , it was the most natural thing in [the world]609-the world that [she]77-miss monro should settle in [East Chester]33-east chester ; and one after another of [[her]77-miss monro daughters]313-her daughters had become first [[Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's pupil]2168-miss monro 's pupil and afterwards [[her]77-miss monro friend]2966-her friend . [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes [herself]165-mrs. forbes had always been strongly attracted by [Ellinor]73-ellinor , but it was long before [she]165-mrs. forbes could conquer the timid reserve by which [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins was hedged round . It was [Miss Monro]77-miss monro , who was [herself]77-miss monro incapable of jealousy , who persevered in praising [them]2170-them to [one another]2171-one another , and in bringing [them]2170-them together ; and now [Ellinor]73-ellinor was as intimate and familiar in [[Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes 's household]2172-mrs. forbes 's household as [she]73-ellinor ever could be with [any family not [her]73-ellinor own]2173-any family not her own . [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes was considered to be a little fanciful as to illness ; but it was no wonder , remembering how many [sisters]605-sisters [she]165-mrs. forbes had lost by consumption . [Miss Monro]77-miss monro had often grumbled at the way in which [her]77-miss monro pupils were made irregular for very trifling causes . But [no one]385-no one so alarmed as [she]165-mrs. forbes , when , in the autumn succeeding [Mr. Ness]80-mr. ness 's death , [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes remarked to [her]77-miss monro on [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's increased delicacy of appearance , and shortness of breathing . From that time forwards [she]165-mrs. forbes worried [Ellinor]73-ellinor ( if [any one so sweet and patient]2176-any one so sweet and patient could ever have been worried ) with respirators and precautions . [Ellinor]73-ellinor submitted to all [[her]165-mrs. forbes friend]2966-her friend 's wishes and cares , sooner than make [her]165-mrs. forbes anxious , and remained a prisoner in [the house]761-the house through the whole of November . Then [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's anxiety took another turn . [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's appetite and spirits failed [her]165-mrs. forbes -- not at all an unnatural consequence of so many weeks ' confinement to [the house]761-the house . A plan was started , quite suddenly , one morning in December , that met with approval from everyone but [Ellinor]73-ellinor , who was , however , by this time too languid to make much resistance . [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes and [[her]165-mrs. forbes daughters]313-her daughters were going to [Rome]8-rome for three or four months , so as to avoid the trying east winds of spring ; why should not [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins go with [them]2181-them ? [They]2181-them urged it , and [Miss Monro]77-miss monro urged it , though with a little private sinking of the heart at the idea of the long separation from [one who was almost like [a child]584-a child to [her]165-mrs. forbes]2182-one who was almost like a child to her . [Ellinor]73-ellinor was , as it were , lifted off [her]73-ellinor feet and borne away by the unanimous opinion of [others]2873-others -- [the doctor]348-the doctor included -- who decided that such a step was highly desirable ; if not absolutely necessary . [She]73-ellinor knew that [she]73-ellinor had only a life interest both in [[[her]73-ellinor father]398-her father 's property]2187-her father 's property and in that bequeathed to [her]73-ellinor by [Mr. Ness]80-mr. ness . Hitherto [she]73-ellinor had not felt much troubled by this , as [she]73-ellinor had supposed that in the natural course of events [she]73-ellinor should survive [Miss Monro]77-miss monro and [Dixon]86-dixon , [both of whom [she]73-ellinor looked upon as dependent upon [her]73-ellinor]2188-both of whom she looked upon as dependent upon her . All [she]73-ellinor had to bequeath to [the two]807-the two was the small savings , which would not nearly suffice for both purposes , especially considering that [Miss Monro]77-miss monro had given up [her]77-miss monro teaching , and that both [she]77-miss monro and [Dixon]86-dixon were passing into years . Before [Ellinor]73-ellinor left [England]9-england [she]73-ellinor had made every arrangement for the contingency of [her]73-ellinor death abroad that [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson could suggest . [She]73-ellinor had written and sent a long letter to [Dixon]86-dixon ; and a shorter one was left in charge of [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone ( [she]73-ellinor dared not hint at the possibility of [her]73-ellinor dying to [Miss Monro]77-miss monro ) to be sent to [the old man]1080-the old man . As [they]2191-they drove out of [the King 's Cross station]2192-the king 's cross station , [they]2191-they passed [[a gentleman]560-a gentleman 's carriage]2194-a gentleman 's carriage entering . [Ellinor]73-ellinor saw [a bright , handsome lady]2195-a bright , handsome lady , [a nurse]2196-a nurse , and [baby]2604-baby inside , and [a gentleman sitting by [them]2191-they whose face [she]73-ellinor could never forget]2198-a gentleman sitting by them whose face she could never forget . It was [Mr. Corbet]81-mr. corbet taking [[his]81-mr. corbet wife]227-his wife and [child]466-child to [the railway]2201-the railway . [They]2191-they were going on a Christmas visit to [East Chester deanery]33-east chester . [He]81-mr. corbet had been leaning back , not noticing [the passers - by]2202-the passers - by , not attending to [the other inmates of [the carriage]2204-the carriage]2203-the other inmates of the carriage , probably absorbed in the consideration of some law case . Such were the casual glimpses [Ellinor]73-ellinor had of one with whose life [she]73-ellinor had once thought [herself]73-ellinor bound up . Who so proud as [Miss Monro]77-miss monro when a foreign letter came ? [[Her]73-ellinor correspondent]2205-her correspondent was not particularly graphic in [her]2205-her correspondent descriptions , nor were there any adventures to be described , nor was the habit of mind of [Ellinor]73-ellinor such as to make [her]73-ellinor clear and definite in [her]73-ellinor own impressions of what [she]73-ellinor saw , and [her]73-ellinor natural reserve kept [her]73-ellinor from being fluent in communicating them even to [Miss Monro]77-miss monro . But [that lady]1574-that lady would have been pleased to read aloud these letters to [the assembled dean and canons]2207-the assembled dean and canons , and would not have been surprised if [they]2207-the assembled dean and canons had invited [her]73-ellinor to [the chapter - house]2208-the chapter - house for that purpose . To [[her]73-ellinor circle of untravelled ladies]2209-her circle of untravelled ladies , ignorant of [Murray]172-murray , but laudably desirous of information , all [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's historical reminiscences and rather formal details were really interesting . There was no railroad in those days between [Lyons]44-lyons and [Marseilles]45-marseilles , so [their]2210-their progress was slow , and the passage of letters to and fro , when [they]2210-their had arrived in [Rome]8-rome , long and uncertain . But all seemed going on well . [Ellinor]73-ellinor spoke of [herself]73-ellinor as in better health ; and [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone ( between whom and [Miss Monro]77-miss monro great intimacy had sprung up since [Ellinor]73-ellinor had gone away , and [Miss Monro]77-miss monro could ask [him]163-canon livingstone to tea ) confirmed this report of [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins 's health from a letter which [he]163-canon livingstone had received from [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes . Curiosity about that letter was [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's torment . What could [they]2211-they have had to write to [each other]523-each other about ? It was a very odd proceeding ; although [the Livingstones]173-the livingstones and [Forbeses]171-the forbeses were distantly related , after the manner of [Scotland]10-scotland . Could it have been that [he]163-canon livingstone had offered to [Euphemia]174-euphemia , after all , and that [[her]174-euphemia mother]458-her mother had answered ; or , possibly , there was a letter from [Effie]174-euphemia [herself]174-euphemia , enclosed . It was a pity for [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's peace of mind that [she]77-miss monro did not ask [him]163-canon livingstone straight away . [She]77-miss monro would then have learnt what [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone had no thought of concealing , that [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes had written solely to give [him]163-canon livingstone some fuller directions about certain charities than [she]77-miss monro had had time to think about in the hurry of starting . As it was , and when , a little later on , [she]77-miss monro heard [him]163-canon livingstone speak of the possibility of [his]163-canon livingstone going [himself]163-canon livingstone to [Rome]8-rome , as soon as [his]163-canon livingstone term of residence was over , in time for the Carnival , [she]77-miss monro gave up [her]77-miss monro fond project in despair , and felt very much like [a child whose house of bricks had been knocked down by the unlucky waft of some passing petticoat]2214-a child whose house of bricks had been knocked down by the unlucky waft of some passing petticoat . Meanwhile , the entire change of scene brought on the exquisite refreshment of entire change of thought . [Ellinor]73-ellinor had not been able so completely to forget [her]73-ellinor past life for many years ; it was like a renewing of [her]73-ellinor youth ; cut so suddenly short by the shears of Fate . Ever since that night , [she]73-ellinor had had to rouse [herself]73-ellinor on awakening in the morning into a full comprehension of the great cause [she]73-ellinor had for much fear and heavy grief . Now , when [she]73-ellinor wakened in [[her]73-ellinor little room]2215-her little room , fourth piano , No . 36 , [Babuino]175-babuino , [she]73-ellinor saw the strange , pretty things around [her]73-ellinor , and [her]73-ellinor mind went off into pleasant wonder and conjecture , happy recollections of the day before , and pleasant anticipations of the day to come . Latent in [Ellinor]73-ellinor was [[her]73-ellinor father]398-her father 's artistic temperament ; everything new and strange was a picture and a delight ; [the merest group in [the street]2218-the street]2217-the merest group in the street , a Roman facchino , with [his]398-her father cloak draped over [his]398-her father shoulder , [a girl going to market or carrying [her]2220-her pitcher back from the fountain]2219-a girl going to market or carrying her pitcher back from the fountain , everything and [every person that presented it or [himself]2221-every person that presented it or himself to her senses to [her]73-ellinor senses]2221-every person that presented it or himself to her senses , gave [them]2222-them a delicious shock , as if it were something strangely familiar from [Pinelli]176-pinelli , but unseen by [her]73-ellinor mortal eyes before . [She]73-ellinor forgot [her]73-ellinor despondency , [her]73-ellinor ill - health disappeared as if by magic ; [the Misses Forbes , who had taken the pensive , drooping invalid]2223-the misses forbes , who had taken the pensive , drooping invalid as a companion out of kindness of heart , found [themselves]2223-the misses forbes , who had taken the pensive , drooping invalid amply rewarded by the sight of [her]73-ellinor amended health , and [her]73-ellinor keen enjoyment of everything , and the half - quaint , half naive expressions of [her]73-ellinor pleasure . So [March]177-march came round ; Lent was late that year . [The great nosegays of violets and camellias]2224-the great nosegays of violets and camellias were for sale at [the corner of [the Condotti]46-the condotti]2225-the corner of the condotti , and [the revellers]2226-the revellers had no difficulty in procuring much rarer flowers for [the belles of [the Corso]47-the corso]2227-the belles of the corso . [The embassies]2228-the embassies had [[their]2228-the embassies balconies]2229-their balconies ; [the attaches of [the Russian Embassy]2231-the russian embassy]2230-the attaches of the russian embassy threw [their]2230-the attaches of the russian embassy light and lovely presents at [every pretty girl]2232-every pretty girl , or suspicion of [a pretty girl]2233-a pretty girl , who passed slowly in [[her]2233-a pretty girl carriage]2234-her carriage , covered over with [her]2233-a pretty girl white domino , and holding [her]2233-a pretty girl wire mask as a protection to [her]2233-a pretty girl face from the showers of lime confetti , which otherwise would have been enough to blind [her]2233-a pretty girl ; [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes had [[her]165-mrs. forbes own hired balcony]2235-her own hired balcony , as became [a wealthy and respectable Englishwoman]2236-a wealthy and respectable englishwoman . [The girls]571-the girls had a great basket full of bouquets with which to pelt [[their]571-the girls friends]1854-their friends in [the crowd below]2239-the crowd below ; [a store of moccoletti]2240-a store of moccoletti lay piled on the table behind , for it was the last day of Carnival , and as soon as dusk came on the tapers were to be lighted , to be as quickly extinguished by every means in [everyone]593-everyone 's power . [The crowd below]2239-the crowd below was at its wildest pitch ; [the rows of stately contadini alone sitting immovable as [[their]571-the girls possible ancestors]2244-their possible ancestors]2243-the rows of stately contadini alone sitting immovable as their possible ancestors , [the senators who received [Brennus]178-brennus and [his]178-brennus Gauls]2245-the senators who received brennus and his gauls . Masks and white dominoes , [foreign gentlemen]2246-foreign gentlemen , and the riffraff of [the city]2864-the city , [slow - driving carriages]2248-slow - driving carriages , showers of flowers , most of [them]2249-them faded by this time , [everyone]593-everyone shouting and struggling at that wild pitch of excitement which may so soon turn into fury . [The Forbes girls]2251-the forbes girls had given place at the window to [[their]2251-the forbes girls mother]2252-their mother and [Ellinor]73-ellinor , who were gazing half amused , half terrified , at [the mad parti - coloured movement below]2253-the mad parti - coloured movement below ; when [a familiar face]2254-a familiar face looked up , smiling a recognition ; and " How shall [I]2254-a familiar face get to [you]2251-the forbes girls ? "[2254-a familiar face] was asked in English , by the well - known voice of [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone . [They]2251-the forbes girls saw [him]163-canon livingstone disappear under [the balcony on which [they]2251-the forbes girls were standing]2255-the balcony on which they were standing , but it was some time before [he]163-canon livingstone made [his]163-canon livingstone appearance in [[their]2251-the forbes girls room]2256-their room . And when [he]163-canon livingstone did , [he]163-canon livingstone was almost overpowered with greetings ; so glad were [they]2251-the forbes girls to see [an East Chester face]2257-an east chester face . " When did [you]2251-the forbes girls come ? Where are [you]2251-the forbes girls ? What a pity [you]2251-the forbes girls did not come sooner ! It is so long since [we]2251-the forbes girls have heard anything ; do tell [us]2251-the forbes girls everything ! It is three weeks since [we]2251-the forbes girls have had any letters ; [those tiresome boats]3102-those tiresome boats have been so irregular because of the weather . "[2257-an east chester face] " How was [everybody]379-everybody -- [Miss Monro]77-miss monro in particular ? "[73-ellinor] [Ellinor]73-ellinor asks . [He]163-canon livingstone , quietly smiling , replied to [their]2251-the forbes girls questions by slow degrees . [He]163-canon livingstone had only arrived the night before , and had been hunting for [them]2251-the forbes girls all day ; but [no one]385-no one could give [him]163-canon livingstone any distinct intelligence as to [their]2251-the forbes girls whereabouts in all the noise and confusion of [the place]1296-the place , especially as [they]2251-the forbes girls had [[their]2251-the forbes girls only English servant]2260-their only english servant with [them]2251-the forbes girls , and the canon was not strong in [his]163-canon livingstone Italian . [He]163-canon livingstone was not sorry [he]163-canon livingstone had missed all but this last day of carnival , for [he]163-canon livingstone was half blinded and wholly deafened , as it was . [He]163-canon livingstone was at [the " Angleterre]48-the " angleterre ; "[163-canon livingstone] [he]163-canon livingstone had left [East Chester]33-east chester about a week ago ; [he]163-canon livingstone had letters for all of [them]2251-the forbes girls , but had not dared to bring [them]2251-the forbes girls through [the crowd]1953-the crowd for fear of having [his]163-canon livingstone pocket picked . [Miss Monro]77-miss monro was very well , but very uneasy at not having heard from [Ellinor]73-ellinor for so long ; the irregularity of [the boats]2262-the boats must be telling both ways , for [[their]2251-the forbes girls English friends]2263-their english friends were full of wonder at not hearing from [Rome]8-rome . And then followed some well - deserved abuse of the Roman post , and some suspicion of the carelessness with which [Italian servants]2264-italian servants posted English letters . All these answers were satisfactory enough , yet [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes thought [she]165-mrs. forbes saw a latent uneasiness in [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone 's manner , and fancied once or twice that [he]163-canon livingstone hesitated in replying to [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's questions . But there was no being quite sure in the increasing darkness , which prevented countenances from being seen ; nor in the constant interruptions and screams which were going on in [the small crowded room]2265-the small crowded room , as wafting handkerchiefs , puffs of wind , or veritable extinguishers , fastened to long sticks , and coming from [nobody]2266-nobody knew where , put out taper after taper as fast as [they]2267-they were lighted . " [You]73-ellinor will come [home]230-home with [us]3105-us , "[165-mrs. forbes] said [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes . " [I]165-mrs. forbes can only offer [you]73-ellinor cold meat with tea ; [[our]3105-us cook]3106-our cook is gone out , this being a universal festa ; but [we]3105-us can not part with [an old friend]3107-an old friend for any scruples as to [the commissariat]3108-the commissariat . "[165-mrs. forbes] " Thank [you]73-ellinor . [I]165-mrs. forbes should have invited [myself]165-mrs. forbes if [you]73-ellinor had not been good enough to ask [me]165-mrs. forbes . "[165-mrs. forbes] When [they]2268-they had all arrived at [[their]2268-they apartment]2269-their apartment in [the Babuino]175-babuino ( [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone had gone round to fetch the letters with which [he]163-canon livingstone was entrusted ) , [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes was confirmed in [her]165-mrs. forbes supposition that [he]163-canon livingstone had something particular and not very pleasant to say to [Ellinor]73-ellinor , by the rather grave and absent manner in which [he]163-canon livingstone awaited [her]165-mrs. forbes return from taking off [her]165-mrs. forbes out - of - door things . [He]163-canon livingstone broke off , indeed , in [his]163-canon livingstone conversation with [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes to go and meet [Ellinor]73-ellinor , and to lead [her]165-mrs. forbes into the most distant window before [he]163-canon livingstone delivered [her]165-mrs. forbes letters . " From what [you]163-canon livingstone said in [the balcony yonder]3109-the balcony yonder , [I]165-mrs. forbes fear [you]163-canon livingstone have not received [your]163-canon livingstone home letters regularly ? "[165-mrs. forbes] " No ! "[165-mrs. forbes] replied [she]165-mrs. forbes , startled and trembling , [she]165-mrs. forbes hardly knew why . " No more has [Miss Monro]77-miss monro heard from [you]163-canon livingstone ; nor , [I]165-mrs. forbes believe , has [some one else who expected to hear]3110-some one else who expected to hear . [[Your]163-canon livingstone man of business]3111-your man of business -- [I]165-mrs. forbes forget [his]3111-your man of business name . "[165-mrs. forbes] " [[My]165-mrs. forbes man of business]3112-my man of business ! Something has gone wrong , [Mr. Livingstone]112-mr. livingstone . Tell [me]165-mrs. forbes -- [I]165-mrs. forbes want to know . [I]165-mrs. forbes have been expecting it -- only tell [me]165-mrs. forbes . "[165-mrs. forbes] [She]165-mrs. forbes sat down suddenly , as white as ashes . " [Dear Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins , [I]165-mrs. forbes 'm afraid it is painful enough , but [you]106-miss wilkins are fancying it worse than it is . All [[your]106-miss wilkins friends]3113-your friends are quite well ; but [an old servant--]3114-an old servant-- "[165-mrs. forbes] " Well ! "[165-mrs. forbes] [she]165-mrs. forbes said , seeing [his]2270-his hesitation , and leaning forwards and griping at [his]2270-his arm . " Is taken up on a charge of manslaughter or murder . Oh ! [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes , come here ! "[165-mrs. forbes] For [Ellinor]73-ellinor had fainted , falling forwards on the arm [she]165-mrs. forbes had held . When [she]73-ellinor came round [she]73-ellinor was lying half undressed on [her]73-ellinor bed ; [they]2271-they were giving [her]73-ellinor tea in spoonfuls . " [I]73-ellinor must get up , "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor moaned . " [I]73-ellinor must go [home]230-home . "[73-ellinor] " [You]73-ellinor must lie still , "[165-mrs. forbes] said [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes , firmly . " [You]73-ellinor do n't know . [I]73-ellinor must go [home]230-home , "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor repeated ; and [she]73-ellinor tried to sit up , but fell back helpless . Then [she]73-ellinor did not speak , but lay and thought . " Will [you]73-ellinor bring [me]73-ellinor some meat ? "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor whispered . " And some wine ? "[73-ellinor] [They]2271-they brought [her]73-ellinor meat and wine ; [she]73-ellinor ate , though [she]73-ellinor was choking . " Now , please , bring [me]73-ellinor [my]73-ellinor letters , and leave [me]73-ellinor alone ; and after that [I]73-ellinor should like to speak to [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone . Do n't let [him]163-canon livingstone go , please . [I]73-ellinor wo n't be long -- half an hour , [I]73-ellinor think . Only let [me]73-ellinor be alone . "[73-ellinor] There was a hurried feverish sharpness in [her]73-ellinor tone that made [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes very anxious , but [she]73-ellinor judged it best to comply with [her]73-ellinor requests . The letters were brought , the lights were arranged so that [she]73-ellinor could read them lying on [her]73-ellinor bed ; and [they]2271-they left [her]73-ellinor . Then [she]73-ellinor got up and stood on [her]73-ellinor feet , dizzy enough , [her]73-ellinor arms clasped at the top of [her]73-ellinor head , [her]73-ellinor eyes dilated and staring as if looking at some great horror . But after a few minutes [she]73-ellinor sat down suddenly , and began to read . Letters were evidently missing . Some had been sent by an opportunity that had been delayed on the journey , and had not yet arrived in [Rome]8-rome . [Others]2873-others had been despatched by the post , but the severe weather , the unusual snow , had , in those days , before the railway was made between [Lyons]44-lyons and [Marseilles]45-marseilles , put a stop to many [a traveller]2273-a traveller 's plans , and had rendered the transmission of the mail extremely uncertain ; so , much of that intelligence which [Miss Monro]77-miss monro had evidently considered as certain to be known to [Ellinor]73-ellinor was entirely matter of conjecture , and could only be guessed at from what was told in these letters . One was from [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson , one from [Mr. Brown]152-mr. brown , one from [Miss Monro]77-miss monro ; of course the last mentioned was the first read . [She]77-miss monro spoke of the shock of the discovery of [Mr. Dunster]84-mr. dunster 's body , found in the cutting of [the new line of railroad]2274-the new line of railroad from [Hamley]1-hamley to [the nearest railway station]2275-the nearest railway station ; the body so hastily buried long ago , in [its]2276-its clothes , by which it was now recognised -- a recognition confirmed by one or two more personal and indestructible things , such as [his]84-mr. dunster watch and seal with [his]84-mr. dunster initials ; of the shock to [everyone]593-everyone , [the Osbaldistones]179-the osbaldistones in particular , on the further discovery of a fleam or horse - lancet , having the name of [Abraham Dixon]86-dixon engraved on the handle ; how [Dixon]86-dixon had gone on [Mr. Osbaldistone]145-mr. osbaldistone 's business to a horse - fair in [Ireland]50-ireland some weeks before this , and had had [his]86-dixon leg broken by a kick from an unruly mare , so that [he]86-dixon was barely able to move about when [the officers of justice]2278-the officers of justice went to apprehend [him]86-dixon in [Tralee]51-tralee . At this point [Ellinor]73-ellinor cried out loud and shrill . " Oh , [Dixon]86-dixon ! [Dixon]86-dixon ! and [I]73-ellinor was away enjoying [myself]73-ellinor . "[73-ellinor] [They]2279-they heard [her]73-ellinor cry , and came to the door , but it was bolted inside . " Please , go away , "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor said ; " please , go . [I]73-ellinor will be very quiet ; only , please , go . "[73-ellinor] [She]73-ellinor could not bear just then to read any more of [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's letter ; [she]73-ellinor tore open [Mr. Johnson's]181-mr. johnson's -- the date was a fortnight earlier than [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's ; [he]181-mr. johnson's also expressed [his]181-mr. johnson's wonder at not hearing from [her]73-ellinor , in reply to [his]181-mr. johnson's letter of January 9 ; but [he]181-mr. johnson's added , that [he]181-mr. johnson's thought that [[her]73-ellinor trustees]2280-her trustees had judged rightly ; the handsome sum [the railway company]2281-the railway company had offered for [the land]2282-the land when [[their]2280-her trustees surveyor]2283-their surveyor decided on the alteration of the line , [Mr. Osbaldistone]145-mr. osbaldistone , & amp;c . & amp;c . [She]73-ellinor could not read anymore ; it was [Fate]182-fate pursuing [her]73-ellinor . Then [she]73-ellinor took the letter up again and tried to read ; but all that reached [her]73-ellinor understanding was the fact that [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson had sent [his]181-mr. johnson's present letter to [Miss Monro]77-miss monro , thinking that [she]73-ellinor might know of some private opportunity safer than [the post]2284-the post . [Mr. Brown]152-mr. brown 's was just such a letter as [he]181-mr. johnson's occasionally sent [her]73-ellinor from time to time ; a correspondence that arose out of [their]2285-their mutual regard for [[their]2285-their dead friend]2286-their dead friend [Mr. Ness]80-mr. ness . It , too , had been sent to [Miss Monro]77-miss monro to direct . [Ellinor]73-ellinor was on the point of putting it aside entirely , when the name of [Corbet]81-mr. corbet caught [her]73-ellinor eye : " [You]73-ellinor will be interested to hear that [the old pupil of [[our]2285-their departed friend]3118-our departed friend , who was so anxious to obtain the folio _ Virgil _ with the Italian notes , is appointed [the new judge in [room of]3120-room of [Mr. Justice Jenkin]183-mr. justice jenkin]3119-the new judge in room of mr. justice jenkin]3117-the old pupil of our departed friend , who was so anxious to obtain the folio _ virgil _ with the italian notes , is appointed the new judge in room of mr. justice jenkin . At least [I]81-mr. corbet conclude that [Mr. Ralph Corbet]81-mr. corbet , Q.C. , is the same as [the _ Virgil _ fancier]3121-the _ virgil _ fancier . "[81-mr. corbet] " Yes , "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor , bitterly ; " [he]81-mr. corbet judged well ; it would never have done . "[73-ellinor] They were the first words of anything like reproach which [she]73-ellinor ever formed in [her]73-ellinor own mind during all these years . [She]73-ellinor thought for a few moments of the old times ; it seemed to steady [her]73-ellinor brain to think of them . Then [she]73-ellinor took up and finished [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's letter . [That excellent friend]2287-that excellent friend had done all which [she]77-miss monro thought [Ellinor]73-ellinor would have wished without delay . [She]73-ellinor had written to [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson , and charged [him]143-mr. johnson to do everything [he]143-mr. johnson could to defend [Dixon]86-dixon and to spare no expense . [She]73-ellinor was thinking of going to [the prison in [the county town]211-the county town]2288-the prison in the county town , to see [the old man]1080-the old man [herself]73-ellinor , but [Ellinor]73-ellinor could perceive that all these endeavours and purposes of [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's were based on love for [[her]73-ellinor own pupil]2291-her own pupil , and a desire to set [her]73-ellinor mind at ease as far as [she]73-ellinor could , rather than from any idea that [Dixon]86-dixon [himself]86-dixon could be innocent . [Ellinor]73-ellinor put down the letters , and went to the door , then turned back , and locked them up in [her]73-ellinor writing - case with trembling hands ; and after that [she]73-ellinor entered [the drawing - room]573-the drawing - room , looking liker to a ghost than to [a living woman]2293-a living woman . " Can [I]73-ellinor speak to [you]163-canon livingstone for a minute alone ? "[73-ellinor] [Her]73-ellinor still , tuneless voice made the words into a command . "[163-canon livingstone] " [Miss Monro]77-miss monro was [[my]73-ellinor informant]3122-my informant -- at least at first -- it was in the _ Times _ the day before [I]73-ellinor left . [Miss Monro]77-miss monro says it could only have been done in a moment of anger if [the old servant]2137-the old servant is really guilty ; that [he]1223-the dead man was as steady and good a man as [she]77-miss monro ever knew , and [she]77-miss monro seems to have a strong feeling against [Mr. Dunster]84-mr. dunster , as always giving [[your]163-canon livingstone father]2658-your father much unnecessary trouble ; in fact , [she]77-miss monro hints that [his]1223-the dead man disappearance at the time was supposed to be the cause of a considerable loss of property to [Mr. Wilkins]66-mr. wilkins . "[73-ellinor] " No ! "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor , eagerly , feeling that some justice ought to be done to [the dead man]1223-the dead man ; and then [she]73-ellinor stopped short , fearful of saying anything that should betray [her]73-ellinor full knowledge . " [I]73-ellinor mean this , "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor went on ; " [Mr. Dunster]84-mr. dunster was [a very disagreeable man]3125-a very disagreeable man personally -- and [papa]2614-papa -- [we]3127-we none of [us]3127-we liked [him]84-mr. dunster ; but [he]84-mr. dunster was quite honest -- please remember that . "[73-ellinor] [The canon]1848-the canon bowed , and said a few acquiescing words . [He]1848-the canon waited for [her]73-ellinor to speak again . " [Miss Monro]77-miss monro says [she]77-miss monro is going to see [Dixon]86-dixon in-- "[1848-the canon] " Oh , [Mr. Livingstone]112-mr. livingstone , [I]1848-the canon ca n't bear it !
