[She]73-ellinor looked up at [him]1848-the canon with a poor attempt at an apologetic smile : " It is so terrible to think of [that good old man]3128-that good old man in [prison]3129-prison ! "[73-ellinor] " [You]112-mr. livingstone do not believe [him]3128-that good old man guilty ! "[163-canon livingstone] said [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone , in some surprise . " [I]163-canon livingstone am afraid , from all [I]163-canon livingstone heard and read , there is but little doubt that [he]3128-that good old man did kill [the man]1225-the man ; [I]163-canon livingstone trust in some moment of irritation , with no premeditated malice . "[163-canon livingstone] [Ellinor]73-ellinor shook [her]73-ellinor head . " How soon can [I]73-ellinor get to [England]9-england ? "[73-ellinor] asked [she]73-ellinor . " [I]73-ellinor must start at once . "[73-ellinor] " [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes sent out while [you]112-mr. livingstone were lying down . "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor , starting up . " [I]73-ellinor must go ; please help [me]73-ellinor . [He]3128-that good old man may be tried before [I]73-ellinor can get [there]538-there ! "[73-ellinor] " Alas ! [I]73-ellinor fear that will be the case , whatever haste [you]112-mr. livingstone make . The trial was to come on at [the Hellingford Assizes]3133-the hellingford assizes , and [that town]3134-that town stands first on the [Midland]52-midland Circuit list . To - day is the 27th of February ; the assizes begin on the 7th of March . "[73-ellinor] " [I]2297-i will start to - morrow morning early for [Civita]53-civita ; there may be [a boat]3135-a boat [there]538-there [they]3137-they do not know of here . At any rate , [I]2297-i shall be on [my]2297-i way . If [he]3128-that good old man dies , [I]2297-i must die too . Oh ! [I]2297-i do n't know what [I]2297-i am saying , [I]2297-i am so utterly crushed down ! It would be such a kindness if [you]112-mr. livingstone would go away , and let [no one]385-no one come to [me]2297-i . [I]2297-i know [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes is so good , [she]165-mrs. forbes will forgive [me]2297-i . [I]2297-i will say good - by to [you]112-mr. livingstone all before [I]2297-i go to - morrow morning ; but [I]2297-i must think now . "[2297-i] For one moment [he]2297-i stood looking at [her]2298-her as if [he]2297-i longed to comfort [her]2298-her by more words . [He]2297-i thought better of it , however , and silently left [the room]479-the room . For a long time [Ellinor]73-ellinor sat still ; now and then taking up [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's letter , and re - reading the few terrible details . Then [she]73-ellinor bethought [her]73-ellinor that possibly [the canon]1848-the canon might have brought a copy of the _ Times _ , containing the examination of [Dixon]86-dixon before [the magistrates]2301-the magistrates , and [she]73-ellinor opened the door and called to [a passing servant]2302-a passing servant to make the inquiry . [She]73-ellinor was quite right in [her]73-ellinor conjecture ; [Dr. Livingstone]184-dr. livingstone had had the paper in [his]184-dr. livingstone pocket during [his]184-dr. livingstone interview with [her]2298-her ; but [he]184-dr. livingstone thought the evidence so conclusive , that the perusal of it would only be adding to [her]2298-her extreme distress by accelerating the conviction of [Dixon]86-dixon 's guilt , which [he]184-dr. livingstone believed [she]2298-her must arrive at sooner or later . [He]184-dr. livingstone had been reading the report over with [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes and [[her]165-mrs. forbes daughters]313-her daughters , after [his]184-dr. livingstone return from [[Ellinor]73-ellinor 's room]2304-ellinor 's room , and [they]2305-they were all participating in [his]184-dr. livingstone opinion upon it , when [her]2298-her request for the _ Times _ was brought . [They]2305-they had reluctantly agreed , saying there did not appear to be a shadow of doubt on the fact of [Dixon]86-dixon 's having killed [Mr. Dunster]84-mr. dunster , only hoping there might prove to be some extenuating circumstances , which [Ellinor]73-ellinor had probably recollected , and which [she]2298-her was desirous of producing on the approaching trial . [CHAPTER XIII . Ellinor]185-chapter xiii . ellinor , having read the report of [Dixon]86-dixon 's examination in the newspaper , bathed [her]73-ellinor eyes and forehead in cold water , and tried to still [her]73-ellinor poor heart 's beating , that [she]73-ellinor might be clear and collected enough to weigh the evidence . Every line of it was condemnatory . [One or two witnesses]2306-one or two witnesses spoke of [Dixon]86-dixon 's unconcealed dislike of [Dunster]84-mr. dunster , a dislike which [Ellinor]73-ellinor knew had been entertained by [the old servant]2137-the old servant out of a species of loyalty to [[his]2137-the old servant master]480-his master , as well as from personal distaste . [The fleam]2309-the fleam was proved beyond all doubt to be [Dixon]86-dixon 's ; and [a man , who had been stable - boy in [Mr. Wilkins]66-mr. wilkins 's service]2310-a man , who had been stable - boy in mr. wilkins 's service , swore that on the day when [Mr. Dunster]84-mr. dunster was missed , and when [the whole town]2311-the whole town was wondering what had become of [him]84-mr. dunster , [a certain colt of [Mr. Wilkins]66-mr. wilkins 's]2312-a certain colt of mr. wilkins 's had needed bleeding , and that [he]2312-a certain colt of mr. wilkins 's had been sent by [Dixon]86-dixon to [the farrier 's]2313-the farrier 's for a horse - lancet , an errand which [he]84-mr. dunster had remarked upon at the time , as [he]84-mr. dunster knew that [Dixon]86-dixon had a fleam of [his]86-dixon own . [Mr. Osbaldistone]145-mr. osbaldistone was examined . [He]84-mr. dunster kept interrupting [himself]84-mr. dunster perpetually to express [his]84-mr. dunster surprise at the fact of so steady and well - conducted [a man as [Dixon]86-dixon]2314-a man as dixon being guilty of so heinous a crime , and was willing enough to testify to the excellent character which [he]84-mr. dunster had borne during all the many years [he]84-mr. dunster had been in [his]84-mr. dunster ( [Mr. Osbaldistone]145-mr. osbaldistone 's ) service ; but [he]84-mr. dunster appeared to be quite convinced by the evidence previously given of [the prisoner]2315-the prisoner 's guilt in the matter , and strengthened the case against [him]84-mr. dunster materially by stating the circumstance of [the old man]1080-the old man 's dogged unwillingness to have the slightest interference by cultivation with [that particular piece of ground]2145-that particular piece of ground . Here [Ellinor]73-ellinor shuddered . Before [her]73-ellinor , in [that Roman bed - chamber]2318-that roman bed - chamber , rose the fatal oblong [she]73-ellinor knew by heart -- a little green moss or lichen , and thinly- growing blades of grass scarcely covering the caked and undisturbed soil under the old tree . Oh , that [she]73-ellinor had been in [England]9-england when [the surveyors of [the railway between [Ashcombe]54-ashcombe and [Hamley]1-hamley]2320-the railway between ashcombe and hamley had altered [[their]2319-the surveyors of the railway between ashcombe and hamley had altered their line line]2321-their line]2319-the surveyors of the railway between ashcombe and hamley had altered their line ; [she]73-ellinor would have entreated , implored , compelled [[her]73-ellinor trustees]2280-her trustees not to have sold [that piece of ground]2323-that piece of ground for any sum of money whatever . [She]73-ellinor would have bribed [the surveyors]2324-the surveyors , done [she]73-ellinor knew not what -- but now it was too late ; [she]73-ellinor would not let [her]73-ellinor mind wander off to what might have been ; [she]73-ellinor would force [herself]73-ellinor again to attend to the newspaper columns . There was little more : [the prisoner]2315-the prisoner had been asked if [he]2315-the prisoner could say anything to clear [himself]2315-the prisoner , and properly cautioned not to say anything to incriminate [himself]2315-the prisoner . [[The poor old man]2326-the poor old man 's person]2327-the poor old man 's person was described , and [his]2326-the poor old man evident emotion . " [The prisoner]2315-the prisoner was observed to clutch at the rail before [him]2326-the poor old man to steady [himself]2315-the prisoner , and [his]2315-the prisoner colour changed so much at this part of the evidence that [one of [the turnkeys]3141-the turnkeys]3140-one of the turnkeys offered [him]2315-the prisoner a glass of water , which [he]2315-the prisoner declined . [He]2315-the prisoner is [a man of a strongly - built frame , and with rather a morose and sullen cast of countenance]3142-a man of a strongly - built frame , and with rather a morose and sullen cast of countenance . "[2326-the poor old man] " [My]73-ellinor poor , poor [Dixon]86-dixon ! "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor , laying down the paper for an instant , and [she]73-ellinor was near crying , only [she]73-ellinor had resolved to shed no tears till [she]73-ellinor had finished all , and could judge of the chances . There were but a few lines more : " At one time [the prisoner]2315-the prisoner seemed to be desirous of alleging something in [his]2315-the prisoner defence , but [he]2315-the prisoner changed [his]2315-the prisoner mind , if such had been the case , and in reply to [Mr. Gordon]186-mr. gordon ( [the magistrate]3144-the magistrate ) [he]2315-the prisoner only said , ' [You]73-ellinor 've made a pretty strong case out again [me]309-the young man , [gentlemen]3145-gentlemen , and it seems for to satisfy [you]73-ellinor ; so [I]309-the young man think [I]309-the young man 'll not disturb [your]73-ellinor minds by saying anything more . ' Accordingly , [Dixon]86-dixon now stands committed for trial for murder at the next [Hellingford Assizes]55-hellingford assizes , which commence on March the seventh , before [Baron Rushton]187-baron rushton and [Mr. Justice Corbet]188-mr. justice corbet . "[309-the young man] " [Mr. Justice Corbet]188-mr. justice corbet ! "[309-the young man] The words ran through [Ellinor]73-ellinor as though [she]73-ellinor had been stabbed with a knife , and by an irrepressible movement [she]73-ellinor stood up rigid . [The young man]309-the young man , [[her]73-ellinor lover]890-her lover in [her]73-ellinor youth , [the old servant who in those days was perpetually about [her]73-ellinor]2330-the old servant who in those days was perpetually about her -- the two who had so often met in [familiar if not friendly relations]2331-familiar if not friendly relations , now to face [each other]523-each other as [judge and accused]2333-judge and accused ! [She]73-ellinor could not tell how much [Mr. Corbet]188-mr. justice corbet had conjectured from the partial revelation [she]73-ellinor had made to [him]188-mr. justice corbet of the impending shame that hung over [her]73-ellinor and [hers]2334-hers . A day or two ago [she]73-ellinor could have remembered the exact words [she]73-ellinor had used in that memorable interview ; but now , strive as [she]73-ellinor would , [she]73-ellinor could only recall facts , not words . After all , [the Mr. Justice Corbet]188-mr. justice corbet might not be [Ralph]81-mr. corbet . There was one chance in a hundred against the identity of [the two]807-the two . While [she]73-ellinor was weighing probabilities in [her]73-ellinor sick dizzy mind , [she]73-ellinor heard soft steps outside [her]73-ellinor bolted door , and low voices whispering . It was the bedtime of [happy people with hearts at ease]2336-happy people with hearts at ease . Some of the footsteps passed lightly on ; but there was a gentle rap at [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's door . [She]73-ellinor pressed [her]73-ellinor two hot hands hard against [her]73-ellinor temples for an instant before [she]73-ellinor went to open the door . There stood [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes in [her]165-mrs. forbes handsome evening dress , holding a lighted lamp in [her]165-mrs. forbes hand . " May [I]165-mrs. forbes come in , [[my]165-mrs. forbes dear]2732-my dear ? "[165-mrs. forbes] [she]165-mrs. forbes asked . [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's stiff dry lips refused to utter the words of assent which indeed did not come readily from [her]73-ellinor heart . " [I]73-ellinor am so grieved at this sad news which the canon brings . [I]73-ellinor can well understand what a shock it must be to [you]2732-my dear ; [we]3147-us have just been saying it must be as bad for [you]2732-my dear as it would be to [us]3147-us if [[our]3147-us old [Donald]189-donald]3148-our old donald should turn out to have been [a hidden murderer]3149-a hidden murderer all these years that [he]189-donald has lived with [us]3147-us ; [I]73-ellinor really could have as soon suspected [Donald]189-donald as [that white - haired respectable old man who used to come and see [you]2732-my dear at [East Chester]33-east chester]3150-that white - haired respectable old man who used to come and see you at east chester . "[73-ellinor] [Ellinor]73-ellinor felt that [she]73-ellinor must say something . " It is a terrible shock -- [poor old man]3151-poor old man ! and [no friend]3152-no friend near [him]3151-poor old man , even [Mr. Osbaldistone]145-mr. osbaldistone giving evidence again [him]3151-poor old man . Oh , dear , [dear]2849-dear ! why did [I]73-ellinor ever come to [Rome]8-rome ? "[73-ellinor] " Now , [[my]165-mrs. forbes dear]2732-my dear , [you]2732-my dear must not let [yourself]2732-my dear take an exaggerated view of the case . Sad and shocking as it is to have been so deceived , it is what happens to many of [us]3155-us , though not to so terrible a degree ; and as to [your]2732-my dear coming to [Rome]8-rome having anything to do with it-- "[165-mrs. forbes] ( [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes almost smiled at the idea , so anxious was [she]165-mrs. forbes to banish the idea of self - reproach from [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's sensitive mind , but [Ellinor]73-ellinor interrupted [her]165-mrs. forbes abruptly :) " [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes ! did [he]3151-poor old man -- did [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone tell [you]165-mrs. forbes that [I]73-ellinor must leave to- morrow ? [I]73-ellinor must go to [England]9-england as fast as possible to do what [I]73-ellinor can for [Dixon]86-dixon . "[73-ellinor] " Yes , [he]3151-poor old man told [us]3155-us [you]165-mrs. forbes were thinking of it , and it was partly that made [me]73-ellinor force [myself]73-ellinor in upon [you]165-mrs. forbes to - night . [I]73-ellinor think , [[my]73-ellinor love]3156-my love , [you]165-mrs. forbes are mistaken in feeling as if [you]165-mrs. forbes were called upon to do more than what [the canon]1848-the canon tells [me]73-ellinor [Miss Monro]77-miss monro has already done in [your]165-mrs. forbes name -- engaged the best legal advice , and spared no expense to give [the suspected man]3158-the suspected man every chance . What could [you]165-mrs. forbes do more even if [you]165-mrs. forbes were on the spot ? And it is very possible that the trial may have come on before [you]165-mrs. forbes get [home]230-home . Then what could [you]165-mrs. forbes do ? [He]3158-the suspected man would either have been acquitted or condemned ; if [the former]1067-the former , [he]3158-the suspected man would find public sympathy all in [his]3158-the suspected man favour ; it always is for [the unjustly accused]3161-the unjustly accused . And if [he]3158-the suspected man turns out to be guilty , [[my]73-ellinor dear]2732-my dear [Ellinor]73-ellinor , it will be far better for [you]165-mrs. forbes to have all the softening which distance can give to such a dreadful termination to the life of [a poor man whom [you]165-mrs. forbes have respected so long]3163-a poor man whom you have respected so long . "[73-ellinor] But [Ellinor]73-ellinor spoke again with a kind of irritated determination , very foreign to [her]73-ellinor usual soft docility : " Please just let [me]73-ellinor judge for [myself]73-ellinor this once . [I]73-ellinor am not ungrateful . [God]119-god knows [I]73-ellinor do n't want to vex one who has been so kind to [me]73-ellinor as [you]165-mrs. forbes have been , [dear Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes ; but [I]73-ellinor must go -- and every word [you]165-mrs. forbes say to dissuade [me]73-ellinor only makes [me]73-ellinor more convinced . [I]73-ellinor am going to [Civita]53-civita to - morrow . [I]73-ellinor shall be that much on the way . [I]73-ellinor can not rest here . "[73-ellinor] [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes looked at [her]165-mrs. forbes in grave silence . [Ellinor]73-ellinor could not bear the consciousness of that fixed gaze . Yet its fixity only arose from [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes ' perplexity as to how best to assist [Ellinor]73-ellinor , whether to restrain [her]73-ellinor by further advice -- of which the first dose had proved so useless -- or to speed [her]73-ellinor departure . [Ellinor]73-ellinor broke on [her]73-ellinor meditations : " [You]165-mrs. forbes have always been so kind and good to [me,--go]3164-me,--go on being so -- please , do ! Leave [me]73-ellinor alone now , [dear Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes , for [I]73-ellinor can not bear talking about it , and help [me]73-ellinor to go to - morrow , and [you]165-mrs. forbes do not know how [I]73-ellinor will pray to [God]119-god to bless [you]165-mrs. forbes ! "[73-ellinor] Such an appeal was irresistible . [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes kissed [her]165-mrs. forbes very tenderly , and went to rejoin [[her]165-mrs. forbes daughters]313-her daughters , who were clustered together in [[[their]313-her daughters mother]2252-their mother 's bedroom]2339-their mother 's bedroom awaiting [her]73-ellinor coming . " Well , [mamma]2708-mamma , how is [she]73-ellinor ? What does [she]73-ellinor say ? "[165-mrs. forbes] " [She]73-ellinor is in a very excited state , [poor thing]3166-poor thing ! and has got so strong an impression that it is [her]73-ellinor duty to go back to [England]9-england and do all [she]73-ellinor can for [this wretched old man]3167-this wretched old man , that [I]165-mrs. forbes am afraid [we]3168-we must not oppose [her]73-ellinor . [I]165-mrs. forbes am afraid that [she]73-ellinor really must go on Thursday . "[165-mrs. forbes] Although [Mrs. Forbes]165-mrs. forbes secured the services of [a travelling - maid]2340-a travelling - maid , [Dr. Livingstone]184-dr. livingstone insisted on accompanying [Ellinor]73-ellinor to [England]9-england , and it would have required more energy than [she]73-ellinor possessed at this time to combat a resolution which both words and manner expressed as determined . [She]73-ellinor would much rather have travelled alone with [[her]73-ellinor maid]1272-her maid ; [she]73-ellinor did not feel the need of the services [he]184-dr. livingstone offered ; but [she]73-ellinor was utterly listless and broken down ; all [her]73-ellinor interest was centred in the thought of [Dixon]86-dixon and [his]86-dixon approaching trial , and perplexity as to the mode in which [she]73-ellinor must do [her]73-ellinor duty . [They]2342-they embarked late that evening in [the tardy _ Santa Lucia _]2343-the tardy _ santa lucia _ , and [Ellinor]73-ellinor immediately went to [[her]73-ellinor berth]2344-her berth . [She]73-ellinor was not sea - sick ; that might possibly have lessened [her]73-ellinor mental sufferings , which all night long tormented [her]73-ellinor . High - perched in [an upper berth]2345-an upper berth , [she]73-ellinor did not like disturbing [the other occupants of [the cabin]2347-the cabin]2346-the other occupants of the cabin till daylight appeared . Then [she]73-ellinor descended and dressed , and went on [deck]2348-deck ; [the vessel]2349-the vessel was just passing [the rocky coast of [Elba]56-elba]2350-the rocky coast of elba , and the sky was flushed with rosy light , that made the shadows on [the island of the most exquisite purple]2351-the island of the most exquisite purple . [The sea]2352-the sea still heaved with yesterday 's storm , but the motion only added to the beauty of the sparkles and white foam that dimpled and curled on [the blue waters]2353-the blue waters . The air was delicious , after the closeness of [the cabin]2347-the cabin , and [Ellinor]73-ellinor only wondered that [more people]2355-more people were not on [deck]2348-deck to enjoy it . [One or two stragglers]2357-one or two stragglers came up , time after time , and began pacing [the deck]2358-the deck . [Dr. Livingstone]184-dr. livingstone came up before very long ; but [he]184-dr. livingstone seemed to have made a rule of not obtruding [himself]184-dr. livingstone on [Ellinor]73-ellinor , excepting when [he]184-dr. livingstone could be of some use . After a few words of common - place morning greeting , [he]184-dr. livingstone , too , began to walk backwards and forwards , while [Ellinor]73-ellinor sat quietly watching [the lovely island]2359-the lovely island receding fast from [her]73-ellinor view -- a beautiful vision never to be seen again by [her]73-ellinor mortal eyes . Suddenly there was a shock and stound all over [the vessel]2349-the vessel , [her]73-ellinor progress was stopped , and a rocking vibration was felt everywhere . [The quarter- deck]2361-the quarter- deck was filled with blasts of steam , which obscured everything . [Sick people]2362-sick people came rushing up out of [[their]2362-sick people berths]2363-their berths in strange undress ; [the steerage passengers]2364-the steerage passengers -- [a motley and picturesque set of people , in many varieties of gay costume]2365-a motley and picturesque set of people , in many varieties of gay costume -- took refuge on [the quarter - deck]2366-the quarter - deck , speaking loudly in all varieties of French and Italian _ patois _ . [Ellinor]73-ellinor stood up in silent , wondering dismay . Was the _ [Santa Lucia]190-santa lucia _ going down on [the great deep]2367-the great deep , and [Dixon]86-dixon unaided in [his]86-dixon peril ? [Dr. Livingstone]184-dr. livingstone was by [her]73-ellinor side in a moment . [She]73-ellinor could scarcely see [him]184-dr. livingstone for the vapour , nor hear [him]184-dr. livingstone for the roar of the escaping steam . " Do not be unnecessarily frightened , "[184-dr. livingstone] [he]184-dr. livingstone repeated , a little louder . " Some accident has occurred to the engines . [I]184-dr. livingstone will go and make instant inquiry , and come back to [you]73-ellinor as soon as [I]184-dr. livingstone can . Trust to [me]184-dr. livingstone . "[184-dr. livingstone] [He]184-dr. livingstone came back to where [she]73-ellinor sat trembling . " A part of the engine is broken , through the carelessness of [these Neapolitan engineers]3169-these neapolitan engineers ; [they]3169-these neapolitan engineers say [we]3170-we must make for [the nearest port]3171-the nearest port -- return to [Civita]53-civita , in fact . "[184-dr. livingstone] " But [Elba]56-elba is not many miles away , "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor . " If this steam were but away , [you]73-ellinor could see it still . "[73-ellinor] " And if [we]3170-we were landed [there]538-there [we]3170-we might stay on [the island]3173-the island for many days ; no [steamer touches]3174-steamer touches [there]538-there ; but if [we]3170-we return to [Civita]53-civita , [we]3170-we shall be in time for [the Sunday boat]3176-the sunday boat . "[184-dr. livingstone] " Oh , dear , [dear]2849-dear ! "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor . " To - day is the second -- Sunday will be the fourth -- the assizes begin on the seventh ; how miserably unfortunate ! "[73-ellinor] " Yes ! "[2368-he] [he]2368-he said , " it is . And these things always appear so doubly unfortunate when they hinder [[our]3170-we serving others]3178-our serving others ! But it does not follow that because the assizes begin at [Hellingford]57-hellingford on the seventh , [Dixon]86-dixon 's trial will come on so soon . [We]3170-we may still get to [Marseilles]45-marseilles on Monday evening ; on by diligence to [Lyons]44-lyons ; it will -- it must , [I]2368-he fear , be Thursday , at the earliest , before [we]3170-we reach [Paris]7-paris -- Thursday , the eighth -- and [I]2368-he suppose [you]2369-her know of some exculpatory evidence that has to be hunted up ? "[2368-he] [He]2368-he added this unwillingly ; for [he]2368-he saw that [Ellinor]73-ellinor was jealous of the secresy [she]2369-her had hitherto maintained as to [her]2369-her reasons for believing [Dixon]86-dixon innocent ; but [he]2368-he could not help thinking that [she]2369-her , [a gentle , timid woman , unaccustomed to action or business]2370-a gentle , timid woman , unaccustomed to action or business , would require some of the assistance which [he]2368-he would have been so thankful to give [her]2369-her ; especially as this untoward accident would increase the press of time in which what was to be done would have to be done . But no . [Ellinor]73-ellinor scarcely replied to [his]2368-he half - inquiry as to [her]2369-her reasons for hastening to [England]9-england . [She]2369-her yielded to all [his]2368-he directions , agreed to [his]2368-he plans , but gave [him]2368-he none of [her]2369-her confidence , and [he]2368-he had to submit to this exclusion from sympathy in the exact causes of [her]2369-her anxiety . Once more in [the dreary sala]2371-the dreary sala , with the gaudy painted ceiling , the bare dirty floor , the innumerable rattling doors and windows ! [Ellinor]73-ellinor was submissive and patient in demeanour , because so sick and despairing at heart . [[Her]2369-her maid]1272-her maid was ten times as demonstrative of annoyance and disgust ; [she]1272-her maid who had no particular reason for wanting to reach [England]9-england , but who thought it became [her]1272-her maid dignity to make it seem as though [she]1272-her maid had . At length the weary time was over ; and again [they]2373-they sailed past [Elba]56-elba , and arrived at [Marseilles]45-marseilles . Now [Ellinor]73-ellinor began to feel how much assistance it was to [her]2369-her to have [Dr. Livingstone]184-dr. livingstone for a " courier , "[73-ellinor] as [he]2368-he had several times called [himself]2368-he . CHAPTER XIV . " Where now ? "[1848-the canon] said [the canon]1848-the canon , as [they]2373-they approached [the London Bridge station]2375-the london bridge station . " To [the Great Western]3179-the great western , "[1848-the canon] said [she]1848-the canon ; " [Hellingford]57-hellingford is on that line , [I]1848-the canon see . But , please , now [we]2373-they must part . "[1848-the canon] " Then [I]73-ellinor may not go with [you]73-ellinor to [Hellingford]57-hellingford ? At any rate , [you]73-ellinor will allow [me]73-ellinor to go with [you]73-ellinor to [the railway station]3180-the railway station , and do [my]73-ellinor last office as [courier]3181-courier in getting [you]73-ellinor [your]73-ellinor ticket and placing [you]73-ellinor in [the carriage]2204-the carriage . "[73-ellinor] So [they]2373-they went together to [the station]2376-the station , and learnt that [no train]2377-no train was leaving for [Hellingford]57-hellingford for two hours . There was nothing for it but to go to [the hotel close by]2378-the hotel close by , and pass away the time as best [they]2373-they could . [Ellinor]73-ellinor called for [[her]73-ellinor maid]1272-her maid 's accounts , and dismissed [her]1272-her maid . Some refreshment that [the canon]1848-the canon had ordered was eaten , and the table cleared . [He]2381-i began walking up and down [the room]479-the room , [his]2381-i arms folded , [his]2381-i eyes cast down . Every now and then [he]2381-i looked at the clock on the mantelpiece . When that showed that it only wanted a quarter of an hour to the time appointed for [the train]2054-the train to start , [he]2381-i came up to [Ellinor]73-ellinor , who sat leaning [her]73-ellinor head upon [her]73-ellinor hand , [her]73-ellinor hand resting on the table . " [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins , "[2381-i] [he]2381-i began -- and there was something peculiar in [his]2381-i tone which startled [Ellinor--"I]191-ellinor--"i am sure [you]106-miss wilkins will not scruple to apply to [me]2381-i if in any possible way [I]2381-i can help [you]106-miss wilkins in this sad trouble of [yours]106-miss wilkins ? "[2381-i] " No indeed [I]73-ellinor wo n't ! "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor , gratefully , and putting out [her]73-ellinor hand as a token . [He]2381-i took it , and held it ; [she]73-ellinor went on , a little more hastily than before : " [You]2381-i know [you]2381-i were so good as to say [you]2381-i would go at once and see [Miss Monro]77-miss monro , and tell [her]77-miss monro all [you]2381-i know , and that [I]73-ellinor will write to [her]77-miss monro as soon as [I]73-ellinor can . "[73-ellinor] " May [I]2381-i not ask for one line ? "[2381-i] [he]2381-i continued , still holding [her]73-ellinor hand . " Certainly : [so kind a friend]3183-so kind a friend as [you]73-ellinor shall hear all [I]2381-i can tell ; that is , all [I]2381-i am at liberty to tell . "[2381-i] " [A friend]2793-a friend ! Yes , [I]2381-i am [a friend]2793-a friend ; and [I]2381-i will not urge any other claim just now . Perhaps-- "[2381-i] [Ellinor]73-ellinor could not affect to misunderstand [him]2381-i . [His]2381-i manner implied even more than [his]2381-i words . " No ! "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor said , eagerly . " [We]3186-we are [friends]1031-friends . That is it . [I]73-ellinor think [we]3186-we shall always be [friends]1031-friends , though [I]73-ellinor will tell [you]73-ellinor now -- something -- this much -- it is a sad secret . [God]119-god help [me]73-ellinor ! [I]73-ellinor am as guilty as poor [Dixon]86-dixon , if , indeed , [he]86-dixon is guilty -- but [he]86-dixon is innocent -- indeed [he]86-dixon is ! "[73-ellinor] " If [he]86-dixon is no more guilty than [you]73-ellinor , [I]2381-i am sure [he]86-dixon is ! Let [me]2381-i be more than [[your]73-ellinor friend]3189-your friend , [Ellinor]73-ellinor -- let [me]2381-i know all , and help [you]73-ellinor all that [I]2381-i can , with the right of [an affianced husband]3190-an affianced husband . "[2381-i] " No , no ! "[2384-she] said [she]2384-she , frightened both at what [she]2384-she had revealed , and [his]2385-he eager , warm , imploring manner . " That can never be . [You]73-ellinor do not know the disgrace that may be hanging over [me]2385-he . "[2385-he] " If that is all , "[2385-he] said [he]2385-he , " [I]2385-he take [my]2385-he risk -- if that is all -- if [you]2384-she only fear that [I]2385-he may shrink from sharing any peril [you]2384-she may be exposed to . "[2385-he] " It is not peril -- it is shame and obloquy-- "[2384-she] [she]2384-she murmured . " Well ! shame and obloquy . Perhaps , if [I]2384-she knew all [I]2384-she could shield [you]2384-she from it . "[2384-she] " Do n't , pray , speak any more about it now ; if [you]2384-she do , [I]2384-she must say ' No . ' "[2384-she] [She]2384-she did not perceive the implied encouragement in these words ; but [he]2385-he did , and they sufficed to make [him]2385-he patient . The time was up , and [he]2385-he could only render [her]2384-she [his]2385-he last services as " [courier]3181-courier , "[2385-he] and none other but the necessary words at starting passed between [them]2386-them . But [he]2385-he went away from [the station]2376-the station with a cheerful heart ; while [she]2384-she , sitting alone and quiet , and at last approaching near to the place where so much was to be decided , felt sadder and sadder , heavier and heavier . All the intelligence [she]2384-she had gained since [she]2384-she had seen [the _ Galignani]192-the _ galignani _ in [Paris]7-paris , had been from [the waiter at [the Great Western Hotel]2389-the great western hotel , who , after returning from a vain search for [an unoccupied _ Times _]2390-an unoccupied _ times _]2388-the waiter at the great western hotel , who , after returning from a vain search for an unoccupied _ times _ , had volunteered the information that there was an unusual demand for the paper because of [Hellingford Assizes]55-hellingford assizes , and the trial there for murder that was going on . There was no electric telegraph in those days ; at [every station]2391-every station [Ellinor]73-ellinor put [her]73-ellinor head out , and enquired if the murder trial at [Hellingford]57-hellingford was ended . [Some porters]2392-some porters told [her]73-ellinor one thing , some another , in [their]2392-some porters hurry ; [she]73-ellinor felt that [she]73-ellinor could not rely on [them]2392-some porters . " Drive to [[Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson 's in [the High street]3193-the high street]3192-mr. johnson 's in the high street -- quick , quick . [I]2392-some porters will give [you]73-ellinor half - a - crown if [you]73-ellinor will go quick . "[2392-some porters] For , indeed , [her]73-ellinor endurance , [her]73-ellinor patience , was strained almost to snapping ; yet at [[Hellingford]57-hellingford station]2393-hellingford station , where doubtless [they]2392-some porters could have told [her]73-ellinor the truth , [she]73-ellinor dared not ask the question . It was past eight o'clock at night . In [many houses in [the little country town]2395-the little country town]2394-many houses in the little country town there were unusual lights and sounds . [The inhabitants]2396-the inhabitants were showing [their]2396-the inhabitants hospitality to such of [the strangers brought by the assizes]2397-the strangers brought by the assizes , as were lingering [there]538-there now that the business which had drawn [them]2396-the inhabitants was over . [The Judges]2399-the judges had left [the town]277-the town that afternoon , to wind up the circuit by the short list of [a neighbouring county town]2401-a neighbouring county town . [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson was entertaining a dinner - party of [attorneys]366-attorneys when [he]143-mr. johnson was summoned from dessert by the announcement of [a " lady who wanted to speak to [him]143-mr. johnson immediate and particular]3194-a " lady who wanted to speak to him immediate and particular . "[143-mr. johnson] [He]143-mr. johnson went into [[his]143-mr. johnson study]469-his study in not the best of tempers . There [he]143-mr. johnson found [[his]143-mr. johnson client]2404-his client , [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins , white and ghastly , standing by the fireplace , with [her]106-miss wilkins eyes fixed on the door . " It is [you]106-miss wilkins , [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins ! [I]106-miss wilkins am very glad-- "[106-miss wilkins] " [Dixon]86-dixon ! "[106-miss wilkins] said [she]106-miss wilkins . It was all [she]106-miss wilkins could utter . [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson shook [his]143-mr. johnson head . " Ah ; that 's a sad piece of business , and [I]143-mr. johnson 'm afraid it has shortened [your]106-miss wilkins visit at [Rome]8-rome . "[143-mr. johnson] " Is [he--]3195-him ? "[106-miss wilkins] " Ay , [I]143-mr. johnson 'm afraid there 's no doubt of [his]3195-him guilt . At any rate , [the jury]3196-the jury found [him]3195-him guilty , and-- "[143-mr. johnson] " And ! "[106-miss wilkins] [she]106-miss wilkins repeated , quickly , sitting down , the better to hear the words that [she]106-miss wilkins knew were coming-- " [He]3195-him is condemned to death . "[143-mr. johnson] " When ? "[143-mr. johnson] " The Saturday but one after [the Judges]2399-the judges left [the town]277-the town , [I]143-mr. johnson suppose -- it 's the usual time . "[143-mr. johnson] " Who tried [him]3195-him ? "[143-mr. johnson] " [Judge Corbet]193-judge corbet ; and , for [a new judge]3199-a new judge , [I]2405-i must say [I]2405-i never knew one who got through [his]3195-him business so well . It was really as much as [I]2405-i could stand to hear [him]3195-him condemning [the prisoner]2315-the prisoner to death . [Dixon]86-dixon was undoubtedly guilty , and [he]86-dixon was as stubborn as could be -- [a sullen old fellow who would let [no one]385-no one help [him]86-dixon through]3201-a sullen old fellow who would let no one help him through . [I]2405-i 'm sure [I]2405-i did [my]2405-i best for [him]86-dixon at [Miss Monro]77-miss monro 's desire and for [your]3203-your sake . But [he]86-dixon would furnish [me]2405-i with no particulars , help [us]3204-us to no evidence . [I]2405-i had the hardest work to keep [him]86-dixon from confessing all before [witnesses]3205-witnesses , who would have been bound to repeat it as evidence against [him]86-dixon . Indeed , [I]2405-i never thought [he]86-dixon would have pleaded ' Not Guilty . ' [I]2405-i think it was only with a desire to justify [himself]86-dixon in the eyes of [some old Hamley acquaintances]3206-some old hamley acquaintances . [Good God]119-god , [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins ! What 's the matter ? [You]106-miss wilkins 're not fainting ! "[2405-i] [He]2405-i rang the bell till the rope remained in [his]2405-i hands . " [Here]719-here , [Esther]194-esther ! [Jerry]195-jerry ! Whoever [you]106-miss wilkins are , come quick ! [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins has fainted ! Water ! [Wine]196-wine ! Tell [Mrs. Johnson]197-mrs. johnson to come [here]719-here directly ! "[2405-i] [Mrs. Johnson]197-mrs. johnson , [a kind , motherly woman , who had been excluded from the " gentleman 's dinner party]3209-a kind , motherly woman , who had been excluded from the " gentleman 's dinner party , "[2405-i] and had devoted [her]197-mrs. johnson time to superintending the dinner [[her]197-mrs. johnson husband]407-her husband had ordered , came in answer to [his]2405-i call for assistance , and found [Ellinor]73-ellinor lying back in [her]197-mrs. johnson chair white and senseless . " [Bessy]198-bessy , [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins has fainted ; [she]106-miss wilkins has had a long journey , and is in a fidget about [Dixon]86-dixon , [the old fellow who was sentenced to be hung for that murder]3210-the old fellow who was sentenced to be hung for that murder , [you]198-bessy know . [I]2407-i ca n't stop here , [I]2407-i must go back to [those men]1089-those men . [You]198-bessy bring [her]106-miss wilkins round , and see [her]106-miss wilkins to bed . [The blue room]3212-the blue room is empty since [Horner]199-horner left . [She]106-miss wilkins must stop [here]719-here , and [I]2407-i 'll see [her]106-miss wilkins in the morning . Take care of [her]106-miss wilkins , and keep [her]106-miss wilkins mind as easy as [you]198-bessy can , will [you]198-bessy , for [she]106-miss wilkins can do no good by fidgeting . "[2407-i] And , knowing that [he]2407-i left [Ellinor]73-ellinor in good hands , and with plenty of assistance about [her]73-ellinor , [he]2407-i returned to [[his]2407-i friends]1556-his friends . [Ellinor]73-ellinor came to [herself]73-ellinor before long . " It was very foolish of [me]73-ellinor , but [I]73-ellinor could not help it , "[73-ellinor] said [she]73-ellinor , apologetically . " No ; to be sure not , [dear]2849-dear . Here , drink this ; it is some of [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson 's best port wine that [he]143-mr. johnson has sent out on purpose for [you]2849-dear . Or would [you]2849-dear rather have some white soup -- or what ? [We]3215-we 've had everything [you]2849-dear could think of for dinner , and [you]2849-dear 've only to ask and have . And then [you]2849-dear must go to bed , [[my]73-ellinor dear]2732-my dear -- [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson says [you]2849-dear must ; and there 's [a well - aired room]3217-a well - aired room , for [Mr. Horner]199-horner only left [us]3215-we this morning . "[73-ellinor] " [I]197-mrs. johnson must see [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson again , please . "[197-mrs. johnson] " But indeed [you]2849-dear must not . [You]2849-dear must not worry [your]2849-dear poor head with business now ; and [Johnson]143-mr. johnson would only talk to [you]2849-dear on business . No ; go to bed , and sleep soundly , and then [you]2849-dear 'll get up quite bright and strong , and fit to talk about business . "[73-ellinor] " [I]73-ellinor can not sleep -- [I]73-ellinor can not rest till [I]73-ellinor have asked [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson one or two more questions ; indeed [I]73-ellinor can not , "[73-ellinor] pleaded [Ellinor]73-ellinor . [Mrs. Johnson]197-mrs. johnson knew that [[her]197-mrs. johnson husband]407-her husband 's orders on such occasions were peremptory , and that [she]197-mrs. johnson should come in for a good conjugal scolding if , after what [he]407-her husband had said , [she]197-mrs. johnson ventured to send for [him]407-her husband again . Yet [Ellinor]73-ellinor looked so entreating and wistful that [she]73-ellinor could hardly find in [her]73-ellinor heart to refuse [her]73-ellinor . A bright thought struck [her]73-ellinor . " Here is pen and paper , [[my]73-ellinor dear]2732-my dear . Could [you]73-ellinor not write the questions [you]73-ellinor wanted to ask ? and [he]407-her husband 'll just jot down the answers upon the same piece of paper . [I]73-ellinor 'll send it in by [Jerry]195-jerry . [He]407-her husband has got [friends]1031-friends to dinner with [him]407-her husband , [you]73-ellinor see . "[73-ellinor] [Ellinor]73-ellinor yielded . [She]73-ellinor sat , resting [her]73-ellinor weary head on [her]73-ellinor hand , and wondering what were the questions which would have come so readily to [her]73-ellinor tongue could [she]73-ellinor have been face to face with [him]2410-him . As it was , [she]73-ellinor only wrote this : " How early can [I]73-ellinor see [you]2410-him to - morrow morning ? Will [you]2410-him take all the necessary steps for [my]73-ellinor going to [Dixon]86-dixon as soon as possible ? Could [I]73-ellinor be admitted to [him]2410-him to - night ? "[73-ellinor] The pencilled answers were : " Eight o'clock . Yes . No . "[73-ellinor] " [I]73-ellinor suppose [he]2410-him knows best , "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor , sighing , as [she]73-ellinor read the last word . " But it seems wicked in [me]73-ellinor to be going to bed -- and [he]2410-him so near , in [prison]3129-prison . "[73-ellinor] When [she]73-ellinor rose up and stood , [she]73-ellinor felt the former dizziness return , and that reconciled [her]73-ellinor to seeking rest before [she]73-ellinor entered upon the duties which were becoming clearer before [her]73-ellinor , now that [she]73-ellinor knew all and was on the scene of action . [Mrs. Johnson]197-mrs. johnson brought [her]73-ellinor white - wine whey instead of the tea [she]73-ellinor had asked for ; and perhaps it was owing to this that [she]73-ellinor slept so soundly . CHAPTER XV . When [Ellinor]73-ellinor awoke the clear light of dawn was fully in [the room]479-the room . [She]73-ellinor could not remember where [she]73-ellinor was ; for so many mornings [she]73-ellinor had wakened up in strange places that it took [her]73-ellinor several minutes before [she]73-ellinor could make out the geographical whereabouts of the heavy blue moreen curtains , the print of [the lord - lieutenant of [the county]311-the county]310-the lord - lieutenant of the county on the wall , and all the handsome ponderous mahogany furniture that stuffed up [the room]479-the room . As soon as full memory came into [her]73-ellinor mind , [she]73-ellinor started up ; nor did [she]73-ellinor go to bed again , although [she]73-ellinor saw by [her]73-ellinor watch on the dressing - table that it was not yet six o'clock . [She]73-ellinor dressed [herself]73-ellinor with the dainty completeness so habitual to [her]73-ellinor that it had become an unconscious habit , and then -- the instinct was irrepressible -- [she]73-ellinor put on [her]73-ellinor bonnet and shawl , and went down , past [the servant]1239-the servant on [her]73-ellinor knees cleaning [the doorstep]2416-the doorstep , out into the fresh open air ; and so [she]73-ellinor found [her]73-ellinor way down [the High Street]3193-the high street to [Hellingford Castle]58-hellingford castle , [the building in which [the courts of assize]2419-the courts of assize were held]2418-the building in which the courts of assize were held -- [the prison in which [Dixon]86-dixon lay condemned to die]2420-the prison in which dixon lay condemned to die . [She]73-ellinor almost knew [she]73-ellinor could not see [him]86-dixon ; yet it seemed like some amends to [her]73-ellinor conscience for having slept through so many hours of the night if [she]73-ellinor made the attempt . [She]73-ellinor went up to [[the porter]2421-the porter 's lodge]2422-the porter 's lodge , and asked [the little girl]492-the little girl sweeping out [the place]1296-the place if [she]492-the little girl might see [Abraham Dixon]86-dixon . [The child]456-the child stared at [her]73-ellinor , and ran into [the house]761-the house , bringing out [[her]456-the child father]398-her father , [a great burly man , who had not yet donned either coat or waistcoat , and who , consequently , felt the morning air as rather nipping]2428-a great burly man , who had not yet donned either coat or waistcoat , and who , consequently , felt the morning air as rather nipping . To [him]398-her father [Ellinor]73-ellinor repeated [her]73-ellinor question . " [Him]86-dixon as is to be hung come Saturday se'nnight ? Why , [ma'am]3046-ma'am , [I]73-ellinor 've nought to do with it . [You]3046-ma'am may go to [[the governor]3222-the governor 's house]3223-the governor 's house and try ; but , if [you]3046-ma'am 'll excuse [me]73-ellinor , [you]3046-ma'am 'll have [your]3046-ma'am walk for [your]3046-ma'am pains . [Them]3224-them in [the condemned cells]3225-the condemned cells is never seen by [nobody]2266-nobody without [the sheriff]3227-the sheriff 's order . [You]3046-ma'am may go up to [[the governor]3222-the governor 's house]3223-the governor 's house and welcome ; but [they]3224-them 'll only tell [you]3046-ma'am the same . Yon 's [[the governor]3222-the governor 's house]3223-the governor 's house . "[73-ellinor] [Ellinor]73-ellinor fully believed [the man]1225-the man , and yet [she]73-ellinor went on to [the house]761-the house indicated , as if [she]73-ellinor still hoped that in [her]73-ellinor case there might be some exception to the rule , which [she]73-ellinor now remembered to have heard of before , in days when such a possible desire as to see [a condemned prisoner]2431-a condemned prisoner was treated by [her]73-ellinor as a wish that [some people]648-some people might have , did have -- people as far removed from [her]73-ellinor circle of circumstances as [the inhabitants of the moon]2433-the inhabitants of the moon . Of course [she]73-ellinor met with the same reply , a little more abruptly given , as if [every man]2434-every man was from [his]2434-every man birth bound to know such an obvious regulation . [She]73-ellinor went out past [the porter]2421-the porter , now fully clothed . [He]1225-the man was sorry for [her]73-ellinor disappointment , but could not help saying , with a slight tone of exultation : " Well , [you]73-ellinor see [I]1225-the man was right , [ma'am]3046-ma'am ! "[1225-the man] [She]73-ellinor walked as nearly round [the castle]1547-the castle as ever [she]73-ellinor could , looking up at the few high - barred windows [she]73-ellinor could see , and wondering in what part of [the building [Dixon]86-dixon was confined]2437-the building dixon was confined . Then [she]73-ellinor went into [the adjoining churchyard]2438-the adjoining churchyard , and sitting down upon a tombstone , [she]73-ellinor gazed idly at the view spread below [her]73-ellinor -- a view which was considered as the lion of [the place]1296-the place , to be shown to [all strangers]2440-all strangers by [the inhabitants of [Hellingford]57-hellingford]2441-the inhabitants of hellingford . [Ellinor]73-ellinor did not see it , however ; [she]73-ellinor only saw the blackness of that fatal night , the hurried work -- the lanterns glancing to and fro . [She]73-ellinor only heard the hard breathing of [those who are engaged upon unwonted labour]2442-those who are engaged upon unwonted labour ; the few hoarse muttered words ; the swaying of the branches to and fro . All at once the church clock above [her]73-ellinor struck eight , and then pealed out for [distant labourers]2443-distant labourers to cease [their]2443-distant labourers work for a time . Such was the old custom of [the place]1296-the place . [Ellinor]73-ellinor rose up , and made [her]73-ellinor way back to [[Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson 's house in [High Street]59-high street]2445-mr. johnson 's house in high street . [The room]479-the room felt close and confined in which [she]73-ellinor awaited [her]73-ellinor interview with [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson , who had sent down an apology for having overslept [himself]143-mr. johnson , and at last made [his]143-mr. johnson appearance in a hurried half - awakened state , in consequence of [his]143-mr. johnson late hospitality of the night before . " [I]73-ellinor am so sorry [I]73-ellinor gave [you]3233-you all so much trouble last night , "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor , apologetically . " [I]73-ellinor was overtired , and much shocked by the news [I]73-ellinor heard . "[73-ellinor] " No trouble , no trouble , [I]143-mr. johnson am sure . Neither [Mrs. Johnson]197-mrs. johnson nor [I]143-mr. johnson felt it in the least a trouble . [Many ladies]3234-many ladies [I]143-mr. johnson know feel such things very trying , though there are others that can stand [a judge]3235-a judge 's putting on the black cap better than [most men]3236-most men . [I]143-mr. johnson 'm sure [I]143-mr. johnson saw [some as composed as could be]3237-some as composed as could be under [Judge Corbet]193-judge corbet 's speech . "[143-mr. johnson] " But about [Dixon]86-dixon ? [He]86-dixon must not die , [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson . "[143-mr. johnson] " Well , [I]143-mr. johnson do n't know that [he]86-dixon will , "[143-mr. johnson] said [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson , in something of the tone of voice [he]143-mr. johnson would have used in soothing [a child]584-a child . " [Judge Corbet]193-judge corbet said something about the possibility of a pardon . [The jury]3196-the jury did not recommend [him]86-dixon to mercy : [you]143-mr. johnson see , [his]86-dixon looks went so much against [him]86-dixon , and all the evidence was so strong , and no defence , so to speak , for [he]86-dixon would not furnish any information on which [we]3239-we could base defence . But [the judge]3240-the judge did give some hope , to [my]143-mr. johnson mind , though there are others that think differently . "[143-mr. johnson] " [I]143-mr. johnson tell [you]143-mr. johnson , [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson , [he]86-dixon must not die , and [he]86-dixon shall not . To whom must [I]143-mr. johnson go ? "[143-mr. johnson] " Whew ! Have [you]143-mr. johnson got additional evidence ? "[143-mr. johnson] with a sudden sharp glance of professional inquiry . " Never mind , "[73-ellinor] [Ellinor]73-ellinor answered . " [I]73-ellinor beg [your]143-mr. johnson pardon . . . only tell [me]73-ellinor into whose hands the power of life and death has passed . "[73-ellinor] " Into [the Home Secretary's]3241-the home secretary's -- [Sir Phillip Homes]200-sir phillip homes ; but [you]143-mr. johnson can not get access to [him]3241-the home secretary's on such an errand . It is [the judge who tried the case that must urge a reprieve]3242-the judge who tried the case that must urge a reprieve -- [Judge Corbet]193-judge corbet . "[143-mr. johnson] " [Judge Corbet]193-judge corbet ? "[143-mr. johnson] " Yes ; and [he]193-judge corbet was rather inclined to take a merciful view of the whole case . [I]73-ellinor saw it in [his]193-judge corbet charge . [He]193-judge corbet 'll be the person for [you]143-mr. johnson to see . [I]73-ellinor suppose [you]143-mr. johnson do n't like to give [me]73-ellinor [your]143-mr. johnson confidence , or else [I]73-ellinor could arrange and draw up what will have to be said ? "[73-ellinor] " No . What [I]143-mr. johnson have to say must be spoken to [the arbiter]3243-the arbiter -- to [no one else]891-no one else . [I]143-mr. johnson am afraid [I]143-mr. johnson answered [you]143-mr. johnson impatiently just now . [You]143-mr. johnson must forgive [me]143-mr. johnson ; if [you]143-mr. johnson knew all , [I]143-mr. johnson am sure [you]143-mr. johnson would . "[143-mr. johnson] " Say no more , [[my]143-mr. johnson dear lady]3245-my dear lady . [We]3246-we will suppose [you]143-mr. johnson have some evidence not adduced at the trial . Well ; [you]143-mr. johnson must go up and see [the judge]3240-the judge , since [you]143-mr. johnson do n't choose to impart it to [any one]616-any one , and lay it before [him]3240-the judge . [He]3240-the judge will doubtless compare it with [his]3240-the judge notes of the trial , and see how far it agrees with [them]3246-we . Of course [you]143-mr. johnson must be prepared with some kind of proof ; for [Judge Corbet]193-judge corbet will have to test [your]143-mr. johnson evidence . "[143-mr. johnson] " It seems strange to think of [him]3240-the judge as [the judge]3240-the judge , "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor , almost to [herself]73-ellinor . " Why , yes . [He]3240-the judge 's but [a young judge]3250-a young judge . [You]143-mr. johnson knew [him]3240-the judge at [Hamley]1-hamley , [I]73-ellinor suppose ? [I]73-ellinor remember [his]3240-the judge reading [there]538-there with [Mr. Ness]80-mr. ness . "[73-ellinor] " Yes , but do not let [us]3252-us talk more about that time . Tell [me]143-mr. johnson when can [I]143-mr. johnson see [Dixon]86-dixon ? [I]143-mr. johnson have been to [the castle]1547-the castle already , but [they]3254-they said [I]143-mr. johnson must have [a sheriff]3255-a sheriff 's order . "[143-mr. johnson] " To be sure . [I]73-ellinor desired [Mrs. Johnson]197-mrs. johnson to tell [you]143-mr. johnson so last night . [Old Ormerod]201-old ormerod was dining [here]719-here ; [he]201-old ormerod is [clerk to [the magistrates]2301-the magistrates]3257-clerk to the magistrates , and [I]73-ellinor told [him]201-old ormerod of [your]143-mr. johnson wish . [He]201-old ormerod said [he]201-old ormerod would see [Sir Henry Croper]202-sir henry croper , and have the order [here]719-here before ten . But all this time [Mrs. Johnson]197-mrs. johnson is waiting breakfast for [us]3260-us . Let [me]73-ellinor take [you]143-mr. johnson into [the dining - room]745-the dining - room . "[73-ellinor] It was very hard work for [Ellinor]73-ellinor to do [her]73-ellinor duty as [a guest]2448-a guest , and to allow [herself]73-ellinor to be interested and talked to on local affairs by [[her]73-ellinor host]2449-her host and [hostess]2450-hostess . But [she]73-ellinor felt as if [she]73-ellinor had spoken shortly and abruptly to [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson in [their]2451-their previous conversation , and that [she]73-ellinor must try and make amends for it ; so [she]73-ellinor attended to all the details about the restoration of [the church]2452-the church , and the difficulty of getting a good music - master for [the three little [Miss Johnsons]203-miss johnsons]2453-the three little miss johnsons , with all [her]73-ellinor usual gentle good breeding and patience , though [no one]385-no one can tell how [her]73-ellinor heart and imagination were full of the coming interview with [poor old Dixon]86-dixon . By - and - by [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson was called out of [the room]479-the room to see [Mr. Ormerod]204-mr. ormerod , and receive the order of admission from [him]143-mr. johnson . [Ellinor]73-ellinor clasped [her]73-ellinor hands tight together as [she]73-ellinor listened with apparent composure to [Mrs Johnson]197-mrs. johnson 's never- ending praise of the Hullah system . But when [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson returned , [she]73-ellinor could not help interrupting [her]73-ellinor eulogy , and saying-- " Then [I]73-ellinor may go now ? "[73-ellinor] Yes , the order was there -- [she]73-ellinor might go , and [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson would accompany [her]73-ellinor , to see that [she]73-ellinor met with no difficulty or obstacle . As [they]2456-they walked thither , [he]143-mr. johnson told [her]73-ellinor that [some one]1211-some one -- [a turnkey]2458-a turnkey , or [some one]1211-some one -- would have to be present at the interview ; that such was always the rule in the case of [condemned prisoners]2460-condemned prisoners ; but that if [this third person]2461-this third person was " obliging , "[1225-the man] [he]143-mr. johnson would keep out of earshot . [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson quietly took care to see that [the turnkey who accompanied [Ellinor]73-ellinor]2462-the turnkey who accompanied ellinor was " obliging . "[1225-the man] [The man]1225-the man took [her]73-ellinor across [high - walled courts]2464-high - walled courts , along [stone corridors]2465-stone corridors , and through many locked doors , before [they]2456-they came to [the condemned cells]3225-the condemned cells . " [I]143-mr. johnson 've had three at a time in [here]719-here , "[143-mr. johnson] said [he]143-mr. johnson , unlocking the final door , " after [Judge Morton]205-judge morton had been [here]719-here . [We]3264-we always called [him]205-judge morton the ' Hanging Judge . ' But its five years since [he]205-judge morton died , and now there 's never more than one in at a time ; though once it was [a woman]585-a woman for poisoning [[her]585-a woman husband]407-her husband . [Mary Jones]153-jones was [her]585-a woman name . "[143-mr. johnson] [The stone passage out of which [the cells]2468-the cells opened]2467-the stone passage out of which the cells opened was light , and bare , and scrupulously clean . Over each door was a small barred window , and an outer window of the same description was placed high up in [the cell]2469-the cell , which the turnkey now opened . [Old Abraham Dixon]86-dixon was sitting on the side of [his]86-dixon bed , doing nothing . [His]86-dixon head was bent , [his]86-dixon frame sunk , and [he]86-dixon did not seem to care to turn round and see who it was that entered . [Ellinor]73-ellinor tried to keep down [her]73-ellinor sobs while [the man]1225-the man went up to [him]86-dixon , and laying [his]1225-the man hand on [his]86-dixon shoulder , and lightly shaking [him]86-dixon , [he]1225-the man said : " Here 's [a friend]2793-a friend come to see [you]86-dixon , [Dixon]86-dixon . "[1225-the man] Then , turning to [Ellinor]73-ellinor , [he]1225-the man added , " There 's [some]986-some as takes it in this kind o ' stunned way , while [others]2873-others are as restless as a wild beast in a cage , after [they]2873-others 're sentenced . "[1225-the man] And then [he]1225-the man withdrew into [the passage]2471-the passage , leaving the door open , so that [he]1225-the man could see all that passed if [he]1225-the man chose to look , but ostentatiously keeping [his]1225-the man eyes averted , and whistling to [himself]1225-the man , so that [he]1225-the man could not hear what [they]2472-they said to [each other]523-each other . [Dixon]86-dixon looked up at [Ellinor]73-ellinor , but then let [his]86-dixon eyes fall on the ground again ; the increasing trembling of [his]86-dixon shrunken frame was the only sign [he]86-dixon gave that [he]86-dixon had recognised [her]73-ellinor . [She]73-ellinor sat down by [him]86-dixon , and took [his]86-dixon large horny hand in [hers]73-ellinor . [She]73-ellinor wanted to overcome [her]73-ellinor inclination to sob hysterically before [she]73-ellinor spoke . [She]73-ellinor stroked the bony shrivelled fingers , on which [her]73-ellinor hot scalding tears kept dropping . " [Dunnot]206-dunnot do that , "[86-dixon] said [he]86-dixon , at length , in a hollow voice . " [Dunnot]206-dunnot take on about it ; it 's best as it is , [missy]3009-missy . "[86-dixon] " No , [Dixon]86-dixon , it 's not best . It shall not be . [You]86-dixon know it shall not -- cannot be . "[73-ellinor] " [I]86-dixon 'm rather tired of living . It 's been a great strain and labour for [me]86-dixon . [I]86-dixon think [I]86-dixon 'd as lief be with [God]119-god as with [men]857-men . And [you]3009-missy see , [I]86-dixon were fond on [him]86-dixon ever sin ' [he]86-dixon were [a little lad]3272-a little lad , and told [me]86-dixon what hard times [he]86-dixon had at [school]3273-school , [he]86-dixon did , just as if [I]86-dixon were [[his]86-dixon brother]1496-his brother ! [I]86-dixon loved [him]86-dixon next to [Molly Greaves]168-mary greaves . born 1797 . [Dear]2849-dear ! and [I]86-dixon shall see [her]168-mary greaves . born 1797 again , [I]86-dixon reckon , come next Saturday week ! [They]3276-they 'll think well on [me]86-dixon , up there , [I]86-dixon 'll be bound ; though [I]86-dixon can not say as [I]86-dixon 've done all as [I]86-dixon should do here below . "[86-dixon] " But , [Dixon]86-dixon , "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor , " [you]86-dixon know who did this -- this-- "[73-ellinor] " Guilty o ' murder , "[2474-he] said [he]2474-he . " That 's what [they]3276-they called it . Murder ! And that it never were , choose who did it . "[2474-he] " [[My]86-dixon poor , poor father]3277-my poor , poor father did it . [I]86-dixon am going up to [London]4-london this afternoon ; [I]86-dixon am going to see [the judge]3240-the judge , and tell [him]3240-the judge all . "[86-dixon] " Do n't [you]73-ellinor demean [yourself]73-ellinor to [that fellow]896-that fellow , [missy]3009-missy . It 's [him]896-that fellow as left [you]73-ellinor in the lurch as soon as sorrow and shame came nigh [you]73-ellinor . "[2474-he] [He]2474-he looked up at [her]73-ellinor now , for the first time ; but [she]73-ellinor went on as if [she]73-ellinor had not noticed those wistful , weary eyes . " Yes ! [I]73-ellinor shall go to [him]896-that fellow . [I]73-ellinor know who it is ; and [I]73-ellinor am resolved . After all , [he]896-that fellow may be better than [a stranger]238-a stranger , for real help ; and [I]73-ellinor shall never remember any -- anything else , when [I]73-ellinor think of [you]73-ellinor , [good faithful friend]3282-good faithful friend . "[73-ellinor] " [He]896-that fellow looks but [a wizened old fellow in [his]896-that fellow grey wig]3283-a wizened old fellow in his grey wig . [I]2475-i should hardly ha ' known [him]896-that fellow . [I]2475-i gave [him]896-that fellow a look , as much as to say , ' [I]2475-i could tell tales o ' [you]896-that fellow , [[my]2475-i lord judge]3284-my lord judge , if [I]2475-i chose . ' [I]2475-i do n't know if [he]896-that fellow heeded [me]2475-i , though . [I]2475-i suppose it were for a sign of [old acquaintance]3285-old acquaintance that [he]896-that fellow said [he]896-that fellow 'd recommend [me]2475-i to mercy . But [I]2475-i 'd sooner have death nor mercy , by long odds . [Yon man out there]3286-yon man out there says mercy means [Botany Bay]60-botany bay . It ' ud be like killing [me]2475-i by inches , that would . It would . [I]2475-i 'd liefer go straight to [Heaven]61-heaven , than live on among [the black folk]3287-the black folk . "[2475-i] [He]2475-i began to shake again : this idea of transportation , from its very mysteriousness , was more terrifying to [him]2475-i than death . [He]2475-i kept on saying plaintively , " [Missy]89-missy , [you]89-missy 'll never let ['em]3288-'em send [me]2475-i to [Botany Bay]60-botany bay ; [I]2475-i could n't stand that . "[2475-i] " No , no ! "[2476-she] said [she]2476-she . " [You]2475-i shall come out of [this prison]3289-this prison , and go [home]230-home with [me]2475-i to [East Chester]33-east chester ; [I]2475-i promise [you]2475-i [you]2475-i shall . [I]2475-i promise [you]2475-i . [I]2475-i do n't yet quite know how , but trust in [my]2475-i promise . Do n't fret about [Botany Bay]60-botany bay . If [you]2475-i go [there]538-there , [I]2475-i go too . [I]2475-i am so sure [you]2475-i will not go . And [you]2475-i know if [you]2475-i have done anything against the law in concealing that fatal night 's work , [I]2475-i did too , and if [you]2475-i are to be punished , [I]2475-i will be punished too . But [I]2475-i feel sure it will be right ; [I]2475-i mean , as right as anything can be , with the recollection of that time present to [us]2478-i , as it must always be . "[2475-i] [She]2477-she almost spoke these last words to [herself]2477-she . [They]2478-i sat on , hand in hand for a few minutes more in silence . " [I]2478-i thought [you]2475-i 'd come to [me]2478-i . [I]2478-i knowed [you]2475-i were far away in foreign parts . But [I]2478-i used to pray to [God]119-god . ' [Dear Lord God]119-god ! ' [I]2478-i used to say , ' let [me]2478-i see [her]3292-her again . ' [I]2478-i told [the chaplain]3293-the chaplain as [I]2478-i 'd begin to pray for repentance , at after [I]2478-i 'd done praying that [I]2478-i might see [you]2475-i once again : for it just seemed to take all [my]2478-i strength to say those words as [I]2478-i 've named . And [I]2478-i thought as how [God]119-god knew what was in [my]2478-i heart better than [I]2478-i could tell [Him]119-god : how [I]2478-i was main and sorry for all as [I]2478-i 'd ever done wrong ; [I]2478-i allays were , at after it was done ; but [I]2478-i thought as [no one]385-no one could know how bitter - keen [I]2478-i wanted to see [you]2480-him . "[2478-i] Again [they]2479-they sank into silence . [Ellinor]73-ellinor felt as if [she]73-ellinor would fain be away and active in procuring [his]2480-him release ; but [she]73-ellinor also perceived how precious [her]73-ellinor presence was to [him]2480-him ; and [she]73-ellinor did not like to leave [him]2480-him a moment before the time allowed [her]73-ellinor . [His]2480-him voice had changed to [a weak , piping old man]2481-a weak , piping old man 's quaver , and between the times of [his]2480-him talking [he]2480-him seemed to relapse into a dreamy state ; but through it all [he]2480-him held [her]73-ellinor hand tight , as though afraid that [she]73-ellinor would leave [him]2480-him . So the hour elapsed , with no more spoken words than those above . From time to time [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's tears dropped down upon [her]73-ellinor lap ; [she]73-ellinor could not restrain them , though [she]73-ellinor scarce knew why [she]73-ellinor cried just then . At length [the turnkey]2482-the turnkey said that the time allowed for the interview was ended . [Ellinor]73-ellinor spoke no word ; but rose , and bent down and kissed [the old man]1080-the old man 's forehead , saying-- " [I]73-ellinor shall come back to - morrow . [God]119-god keep and comfort [you]1080-the old man ! "[73-ellinor] So almost without an articulate word from [him]2480-him in reply ( [he]2480-him rose up , and stood on [his]2480-him shaking legs , as [she]73-ellinor bade [him]2480-him farewell , putting [his]2480-him hand to [his]2480-him head with the old habitual mark of respect ) , [she]73-ellinor went [her]73-ellinor way , swiftly out of [the prison]2484-the prison , swiftly back with [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson to [[his]143-mr. johnson house]552-his house , scarcely patient or strong enough in [her]73-ellinor hurry to explain to [him]2480-him fully all that [she]73-ellinor meant to do . [She]73-ellinor only asked [him]2480-him a few absolutely requisite questions ; and informed [him]2480-him of [her]73-ellinor intention to go straight to [London]4-london to see [Judge Corbet]193-judge corbet . Just before [the railway carriage]2486-the railway carriage in which [she]73-ellinor was seated started on the journey , [she]73-ellinor bent forward , and put out [her]73-ellinor hand once more to [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson . " To - morrow [I]73-ellinor will thank [you]2480-him for all , "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor said . " [I]73-ellinor can not now . "[73-ellinor] It was about the same time that [she]73-ellinor had reached [Hellingford]57-hellingford on the previous night , that [she]73-ellinor arrived at [the Great Western station]2487-the great western station on this evening -- past eight o'clock . On the way [she]73-ellinor had remembered and arranged many things : one important question [she]73-ellinor had omitted to ask [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson ; but that was easily remedied . [She]73-ellinor had not enquired where [she]73-ellinor could find [Judge Corbet]193-judge corbet ; if [she]73-ellinor had , [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson could probably have given [her]73-ellinor [his]143-mr. johnson professional address . As it was , [she]73-ellinor asked for [a Post - Office Directory at [the hotel]2489-the hotel]2488-a post - office directory at the hotel , and looked out for [[his]143-mr. johnson private dwelling--128 [Hyde Park Gardens]62-hyde park gardens]2490-his private dwelling--128 hyde park gardens . [She]73-ellinor rang for [a waiter]2491-a waiter . " Can [I]73-ellinor send a messenger to [Hyde Park Gardens]62-hyde park gardens ? "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor said , hurrying on to [her]73-ellinor business , tired and worn out as [she]73-ellinor was . " It is only to ask if [Judge Corbet]193-judge corbet is at [home]230-home this evening . If [he]143-mr. johnson is , [I]73-ellinor must go and see [him]143-mr. johnson . "[73-ellinor] [The waiter]2492-the waiter was a little surprised , and would gladly have had [her]73-ellinor name to authorise the enquiry but [she]73-ellinor could not bear to send it : it would be bad enough that first meeting , without the feeling that [he]143-mr. johnson , too , had had time to recall all the past days . Better to go in upon [him]143-mr. johnson unprepared , and plunge into the subject . [The waiter]2492-the waiter returned with the answer while [she]73-ellinor yet was pacing up and down [the room]479-the room restlessly , nerving [herself]73-ellinor for the interview . " [The messenger]3296-the messenger has been to [Hyde Park Gardens]62-hyde park gardens , [ma'am]3046-ma'am . [The Judge]3240-the judge and [Lady Corbet]207-lady corbet are gone out to dinner . "[73-ellinor] [Lady Corbet]207-lady corbet ! Of course [Ellinor]73-ellinor knew that [he]143-mr. johnson was married . Had [she]73-ellinor not been present at the wedding in [East Chester Cathedral]38-east chester cathedral ? But , somehow , these recent events had so carried [her]73-ellinor back to old times , that the intimate association of the names , " [the Judge]3240-the judge and [Lady Corbet]207-lady corbet , "[73-ellinor] seemed to awaken [her]73-ellinor out of some dream . " Oh , very well , "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor said , just as if these thoughts were not passing rapidly through [her]73-ellinor mind . " Let [me]73-ellinor be called at seven to - morrow morning , and let [me]73-ellinor have [a cab]3300-a cab at the door to [Hyde Park Gardens]62-hyde park gardens at eight . "[73-ellinor] And so [she]73-ellinor went to bed ; but scarcely to sleep . All night long [she]73-ellinor had the scenes of those old times , the happy , happy days of [her]73-ellinor youth , the one terrible night that cut all happiness short , present before [her]73-ellinor . [She]73-ellinor could almost have fancied that [she]73-ellinor heard the long - silent sounds of [[her]73-ellinor father]398-her father 's step , [[her]73-ellinor father]398-her father 's way of breathing , the rustle of [his]398-her father newspaper as [he]398-her father hastily turned it over , coming through the lapse of years ; the silence of the night . [She]73-ellinor knew that [she]73-ellinor had the little writing - case of [[her]73-ellinor girlhood]2497-her girlhood with [her]73-ellinor , in [her]73-ellinor box . The treasures of the dead that it contained , the morsel of dainty sewing , [the little sister]2498-the little sister 's golden curl , the half - finished letter to [Mr. Corbet]81-mr. corbet , were all there . [She]73-ellinor took them out , and looked at [each separately]2499-each separately ; looked at [them]2499-each separately long -- long and wistfully . " Will it be of any use to [me]73-ellinor ? "[73-ellinor] [she]73-ellinor questioned of [herself]73-ellinor , as [she]73-ellinor was about to put [[her]73-ellinor father]398-her father 's letter back into its receptacle . [She]73-ellinor read the last words over again , once more : " From [my]73-ellinor death - bed [I]73-ellinor adjure [you]3301-you to stand [[her]3302-her friend]2966-her friend ; [I]73-ellinor will beg pardon on [my]73-ellinor knees for anything . "[73-ellinor] " [I]73-ellinor will take it , "[73-ellinor] thought [she]73-ellinor . " [I]73-ellinor need not bring it out ; most likely there will be no need for it , after what [I]73-ellinor shall have to say . All is so altered , so changed between [us]3304-us , as utterly as if it never had been , that [I]73-ellinor think [I]73-ellinor shall have no shame in showing it [him]398-her father , for [my]73-ellinor own part of it . While , if [he]398-her father sees [poor papa]3305-poor papa 's , dear , [dear papa]3306-dear papa 's suffering humility , it may make [him]398-her father think more gently of one who loved [him]398-her father once though [they]3304-us parted in wrath with [each other]523-each other , [I]73-ellinor 'm afraid . "[73-ellinor] So [she]73-ellinor took the letter with [her]73-ellinor when [she]73-ellinor drove to [Hyde Park Gardens]62-hyde park gardens . Every nerve in [her]73-ellinor body was in such a high state of tension that [she]73-ellinor could have screamed out at [the cabman]2501-the cabman 's boisterous knock at the door . [She]73-ellinor got out hastily , before [any one]616-any one was ready or willing to answer such an untimely summons ; paid [the man]1225-the man double what [he]1225-the man ought to have had ; and stood there , sick , trembling , and humble . [I]2536-the astute lawyer was talking to [the Home Secretary]3322-the home secretary about it only last night . "[2536-the astute lawyer] All the time that [he]2536-the astute lawyer said this [he]2536-the astute lawyer had other thoughts at the back of [his]2536-the astute lawyer mind -- some curiosity , a little regret , a touch of remorse , a wonder how the meeting ( which , of course , would have to be some time ) between [Lady Corbet]207-lady corbet and [Ellinor]73-ellinor would go off ; but [he]2536-the astute lawyer spoke clearly enough on the subject in hand , and no outward mark of distraction from it appeared . [No one]385-no one can ever tell how [Dunster]84-mr. dunster always irritated [papa]2614-papa , "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor , in a stupid , heavy way ; and then [she]73-ellinor sighed . " How do [you]3240-the judge know this ? "[73-ellinor] There was a kind of tender reluctance in [the judge]3240-the judge 's voice , as [he]3240-the judge put all these questions . [Ellinor]73-ellinor had made up [her]73-ellinor mind beforehand that something like them must be asked , and must also be answered ; but [she]73-ellinor spoke like [a sleep - walker]2550-a sleep - walker . " [I]73-ellinor came into [[papa]2614-papa 's room]3336-papa 's room just after [he]2614-papa had struck [Mr. Dunster]84-mr. dunster the blow . [He]2614-papa was lying insensible , as [we]3337-we thought -- dead , as [he]2614-papa really was . "[73-ellinor] " What was [Dixon]86-dixon 's part in it ? [He]2614-papa must have known a good deal about it . And the horse - lancet that was found with [his]2614-papa name upon it ? "[73-ellinor] " [Papa]109-papa went to wake [Dixon]86-dixon , and [he]109-papa brought [his]109-papa fleam -- [I]3240-the judge suppose to try and bleed [him]86-dixon . [I]3240-the judge have said enough , have [I]3240-the judge not ? [I]3240-the judge seem so confused . But [I]3240-the judge will answer any question to make it appear that [Dixon]86-dixon is innocent . "[3240-the judge] [The judge]3240-the judge had been noting all down . [He]3240-the judge sat still now without replying to [her]2552-her . Then [he]3240-the judge wrote rapidly , referring to [his]3240-the judge previous paper , from time to time . In five minutes or so [he]3240-the judge read the facts which [Ellinor]73-ellinor had stated , as [he]3240-the judge now arranged them , in a legal and connected form . [He]3240-the judge just asked [her]2552-her one or two trivial questions as [he]3240-the judge did so . Then [he]3240-the judge read it over to [her]2552-her , and asked [her]2552-her to sign it . [She]2552-her took up the pen , and held it , hesitating . " This will never be made public ? "[2552-her] said [she]2552-her . " No ; [I]2552-her shall take care that [no one]385-no one but [the Home Secretary]3322-the home secretary sees it . "[2552-her] " Thank [you]3240-the judge . [I]3240-the judge could not help it , now it has come to this . " [Ellinor]73-ellinor ! "[3240-the judge] said [the judge]3240-the judge , after a moment 's pause , " [we]2555-both of them are [friends]1031-friends , [I]3240-the judge hope ? "[73-ellinor] " No , thank [you]2559-you ; [I]2560-her would rather not . [You]2559-you are very kind , and [I]2560-her am very glad to have seen [you]2559-you once again .
