" This note to [you]2559-you was found under [papa]2614-papa 's pillow after [his]2614-papa death ; some of it refers to past things ; but [I]2560-her should be glad if [you]2559-you could think as kindly as [you]2559-you can of poor papa -- and so -- if [you]2559-you will read it-- "[2560-her] [He]2561-he took it and read it , not without emotion . Then [he]2561-he laid it down on [his]2561-he table , and said-- " [Poor man]2843-poor man ! [he]2843-poor man must have suffered a great deal for that night 's work . And [you]2559-you , [Ellinor]73-ellinor , [you]2559-you have suffered , too . "[2561-he] Yes , [she]2560-her had suffered ; and [he]2561-he who spoke had been one of the instruments of [her]2560-her suffering , although [he]2561-he seemed forgetful of it . [She]2560-her shook [her]2560-her head a little for reply . Then [she]2560-her looked up at [him]2561-he -- [they]2562-they were both standing at the time -- and said : " [I]2560-her think [I]2560-her shall be happier now . [I]2560-her always knew it must be found out . Once more , good - by , and thank [you]2561-he . [I]2560-her may take this letter , [I]2560-her suppose ? "[2560-her] said [she]2560-her , casting envious loving eyes at [[her]2560-her father]398-her father 's note , lying unregarded on the table . " Oh ! certainly , certainly , "[2561-he] said [he]2561-he ; and then [he]2561-he took [her]2560-her hand ; [he]2561-he held it , while [he]2561-he looked into [her]2560-her face . [He]2561-he had thought it changed when [he]2561-he had first seen [her]2560-her , but it was now almost the same to [him]2561-he as of [yore]2564-yore . The sweet shy eyes , the indicated dimple in the cheek , and something of fever had brought a faint pink flush into [her]2560-her usually colourless cheeks . [Married]210-married judge though [he]2561-he was , [he]2561-he was not sure if [she]2560-her had not more charms for [him]2561-he still in [her]2560-her sorrow and [her]2560-her shabbiness than [the handsome stately wife in [the next room]2566-the next room , whose looks had not been of the pleasantest when [he]2561-he left [her]2560-her a few minutes before]2565-the handsome stately wife in the next room , whose looks had not been of the pleasantest when he left her a few minutes before . [He]2561-he sighed a little regretfully as [Ellinor]73-ellinor went away . [He]2561-he had obtained the position [he]2561-he had struggled for , and sacrificed for ; but now [he]2561-he could not help wishing that the slaughtered creature laid on the shrine of [his]2561-he ambition were alive again . [The kedgeree]2567-the kedgeree was brought up again , smoking hot , but it remained untasted by [him]2561-he ; and though [he]2561-he appeared to be reading the _ Times _ , [he]2561-he did not see a word of the distinct type . [[His]2561-he wife]227-his wife , meanwhile , continued [her]227-his wife complaints of [the untimely visitor]2569-the untimely visitor , whose name [he]2561-he did not give to [her]227-his wife in its corrected form , as [he]2561-he was not anxious that [she]227-his wife should have it in [her]227-his wife power to identify the call of this morning with [a possible future acquaintance]2570-a possible future acquaintance . When [Ellinor]73-ellinor reached [[Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson 's house in [Hellingford]57-hellingford]2571-mr. johnson 's house in hellingford that afternoon , [she]73-ellinor found [Miss Monro]77-miss monro was [there]538-there , and that [she]77-miss monro had been with much difficulty restrained by [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson from following [her]77-miss monro to [London]4-london . [Miss Monro]77-miss monro fondled and purred inarticulately through [her]77-miss monro tears over [her]77-miss monro recovered darling , before [she]77-miss monro could speak intelligibly enough to tell [her]77-miss monro that [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone had come straight to see [her]77-miss monro immediately on [his]163-canon livingstone return to [East Chester]33-east chester , and had suggested [her]77-miss monro journey to [Hellingford]57-hellingford , in order that [she]77-miss monro might be of all the comfort [she]77-miss monro could to [Ellinor]73-ellinor . [She]77-miss monro did not at first let out that [he]163-canon livingstone had accompanied [her]77-miss monro to [Hellingford]57-hellingford ; [she]77-miss monro was a little afraid of [Ellinor]73-ellinor 's displeasure at [his]163-canon livingstone being [there]538-there ; [Ellinor]73-ellinor had always objected so much to any advance towards intimacy with [him]163-canon livingstone that [Miss Monro]77-miss monro had wished to make . But [Ellinor]73-ellinor was different now . " How white [you]73-ellinor are , [Nelly]111-nelly ! "[77-miss monro] said [Miss Monro]77-miss monro . " [You]73-ellinor have been travelling too much and too fast , [[my]77-miss monro child]2777-my child . "[77-miss monro] " [My]73-ellinor head aches ! "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor , wearily . " But [I]73-ellinor must go to [the castle]1547-the castle , and tell [[my]73-ellinor poor [Dixon]86-dixon]3350-my poor dixon that [he]86-dixon is reprieved -- [I]73-ellinor am so tired ! Will [you]73-ellinor ask [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson to get [me]73-ellinor leave to see [him]86-dixon ? [He]143-mr. johnson will know all about it . "[73-ellinor] [She]73-ellinor threw [herself]73-ellinor down on the bed in [the spare room]2574-the spare room ; the bed with the heavy blue curtains . After an unheeded remonstrance , [Miss Monro]77-miss monro went to do [her]73-ellinor bidding . But it was now late afternoon , and [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson said that it would be impossible for [him]143-mr. johnson to get permission from [the sheriff]3227-the sheriff that night . " Besides , "[143-mr. johnson] said [he]143-mr. johnson , courteously , " [one]2715-one scarcely knows whether [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins may not give [the old man]1080-the old man false hopes -- whether [she]106-miss wilkins has not been excited to have false hopes [herself]106-miss wilkins ; it might be a cruel kindness to let [her]106-miss wilkins see [him]1080-the old man , without more legal certainty as to what [his]1080-the old man sentence , or reprieve , is to be . By to - morrow morning , if [I]143-mr. johnson have properly understood [her]106-miss wilkins story , which was a little confused-- "[143-mr. johnson] " [She]106-miss wilkins is so dreadfully tired , [poor creature]2841-poor creature , "[77-miss monro] put in [Miss Monro]77-miss monro , who never could bear the shadow of a suspicion that [Ellinor]73-ellinor was not wisest , best , in all relations and situations of life . [Mr. Johnson]143-mr. johnson went on , with a deprecatory bow : " Well , then -- it really is the only course open to [her]106-miss wilkins besides -- persuade [her]106-miss wilkins to rest for this evening . By to - morrow morning [I]143-mr. johnson will have obtained [the sheriff]3227-the sheriff 's leave , and [he]3227-the sheriff will most likely have heard from [London]4-london . "[143-mr. johnson] " Thank [you]143-mr. johnson ! [I]143-mr. johnson believe that will be best . "[143-mr. johnson] " It is the only course , "[143-mr. johnson] said [he]143-mr. johnson . When [Miss Monro]77-miss monro returned to [the bedroom]1345-the bedroom , [Ellinor]73-ellinor was in a heavy feverish slumber ; so feverish and so uneasy did [she]73-ellinor appear , that , after the hesitation of a moment or two , [Miss Monro]77-miss monro had no scruple in wakening [her]73-ellinor . But [she]73-ellinor did not appear to understand the answer to [her]77-miss monro request ; [she]73-ellinor did not seem even to remember that [she]73-ellinor had made any request . The journey to [England]9-england , the misery , the surprises , had been too much for [her]73-ellinor . The morrow morning came , bringing the formal free pardon for [Abraham Dixon]86-dixon . [The sheriff]3227-the sheriff 's order for [her]73-ellinor admission to see [the old man]1080-the old man lay awaiting [her]73-ellinor wish to use it ; but [she]73-ellinor knew nothing of all this . For days , nay weeks , [she]73-ellinor hovered between life and death , tended , as of old , by [Miss Monro]77-miss monro , while [good Mrs. Johnson]197-mrs. johnson was ever willing to assist . One summer evening in early June [she]73-ellinor wakened into memory , [Miss Monro]77-miss monro heard the faint piping voice , as [she]73-ellinor kept [her]73-ellinor watch by the bedside . " Where is [Dixon]86-dixon ? "[73-ellinor] asked [she]73-ellinor . " At [[the canon]1848-the canon 's house at [Bromham]65-bromham]3356-the canon 's house at bromham . "[73-ellinor] This was the name of [[Dr. Livingstone]184-dr. livingstone 's [county parish]2580-county parish]2579-dr. livingstone 's county parish . " Why ? "[184-dr. livingstone] " [We]3357-we thought it better to get [him]86-dixon into country air and fresh scenes at once . "[73-ellinor] " How is [he]86-dixon ? "[184-dr. livingstone] " Much better . Get strong , and [he]86-dixon shall come to see [you]73-ellinor . "[184-dr. livingstone] " [You]73-ellinor are sure all is right ? "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor . " Sure , [[my]73-ellinor dear]2732-my dear . All is quite right . "[73-ellinor] Then [Ellinor]73-ellinor went to sleep again out of very weakness and weariness . From that time [she]73-ellinor recovered pretty steadily . [Her]73-ellinor great desire was to return to [East Chester]33-east chester as soon as possible . The associations of grief , anxiety , and coming illness , connected with [Hellingford]57-hellingford , made [her]73-ellinor wish to be once again in [the solemn , quiet , sunny close of [East Chester]33-east chester]2581-the solemn , quiet , sunny close of east chester . [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone came over to assist [Miss Monro]77-miss monro in managing the journey with [[her]77-miss monro invalid]2582-her invalid . "[77-miss monro] " Please let [him]2584-the tottering old man come directly , "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor , flushing and trembling . [She]73-ellinor went to the door to meet [the tottering old man]2584-the tottering old man ; [she]73-ellinor led [him]2584-the tottering old man to the easy - chair that had been placed and arranged for [herself]73-ellinor ; [she]73-ellinor knelt down before [him]2584-the tottering old man , and put [his]2584-the tottering old man hands on [her]73-ellinor head , [he]2584-the tottering old man trembling and shaking all the while . " Forgive [me]73-ellinor all the shame and misery , [Dixon]86-dixon . Say [you]2584-the tottering old man forgive [me]73-ellinor ; and give [me]73-ellinor [your]2584-the tottering old man blessing . And then let never a word of the terrible past be spoken between [us]3361-us . " Better nor t'other ever was . "[2584-the tottering old man] " [He]2584-the tottering old man is [a good man]3363-a good man , "[73-ellinor] said [Ellinor]73-ellinor . But no more was spoken on the subject . The next day , [Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone made [his]163-canon livingstone formal call . At last [he]2584-the tottering old man could speak no longer on everything but that which [he]2584-the tottering old man had most at heart . " [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins ! "[2584-the tottering old man] ( [he]2584-the tottering old man had got up , and was standing by the mantelpiece , apparently examining the ornaments upon it)--"Miss [Wilkins]106-miss wilkins ! is there any chance of [your]106-miss wilkins giving [me]73-ellinor a favourable answer now -- [you]106-miss wilkins know what [I]73-ellinor mean -- what [we]2587-we spoke about at [the Great Western Hotel]2389-the great western hotel , that day ? "[73-ellinor] [Ellinor]73-ellinor hung [her]73-ellinor head . " [You]106-miss wilkins know that [I]73-ellinor was once engaged before ? "[73-ellinor] " Yes ! [I]73-ellinor have loved [you]106-miss wilkins , and [you]106-miss wilkins only , ever since [we]2587-we met , eighteen years ago . [Miss Wilkins]106-miss wilkins -- [Ellinor]73-ellinor -- put [me]73-ellinor out of suspense . "[73-ellinor] " [I]73-ellinor will ! " Wait -- [you]2588-you have not heard all -- [[my]73-ellinor poor , poor father]3277-my poor , poor father , in a fit of anger , irritated beyond [his]3277-my poor , poor father bearing , struck the blow that killed [Mr. Dunster]84-mr. dunster -- [Dixon]86-dixon and [I]73-ellinor knew of it , just after the blow was struck -- [we]2587-we helped to hide it -- [we]2587-we kept the secret -- [[my]73-ellinor poor father]3369-my poor father died of sorrow and remorse -- [you]2588-you now know all -- can [you]2588-you still love [me]73-ellinor ? "[2588-you] [Those who pass through [the village of Bromham]2591-the village of bromham]2590-those who pass through the village of bromham , and pause to look over the laurel - hedge that separates [the rectory garden]2592-the rectory garden from [the road]1794-the road , may often see , on summer days , [an old , old man]2594-an old , old man , sitting in a wicker - chair , out upon [the lawn]1391-the lawn . [He]2594-an old , old man leans upon [his]2594-an old , old man stick , and seldom raises [his]2594-an old , old man bent head ; but for all that [his]2594-an old , old man eyes are on a level with [the two little fairy children who come to [him]2594-an old , old man]2596-the two little fairy children who come to him in all [their]2596-the two little fairy children who come to him small joys and sorrows , and who learnt to lisp [his]2594-an old , old man name almost as soon as [they]2596-the two little fairy children who come to him did that of [[their]2596-the two little fairy children who come to him father and [mother]2598-mother]2597-their father and mother . Nor is [Miss Monro]77-miss monro often absent ; and although [she]77-miss monro prefers to retain [the old house]2599-the old house in [the Close]1771-the close for winter quarters , [she]77-miss monro generally makes [her]77-miss monro way across to [[Canon Livingstone]163-canon livingstone 's residence]2601-canon livingstone 's residence every evening . SO ENDS " A DARK NIGHT 'S WORK . "[77-miss monro] * * *
